<div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv> Dismantles, repairs, assembles, installs and sets up electrical equipment, house installations and machines used in a production site.\n <div>\n   Position Overview\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Plans and executes assigned maintenance projects.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Dismantles, repairs, assembles, installs and sets up electrical equipment, house installations and machines used in a production site.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Analyzes technical problems on site, and completes repairs and work orders, with specific reference to infrastructural electrical systems.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Executes ramp up, set up and start procedures in order to prepare machines and equipment for operations.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Contributes to installation projects on site, and support accountable Industrial Engineers.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Supports maintenance of technical documentations of processes and equipment.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     May advise junior staff technically.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Job Responsibilities\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Use all required safety equipment and follow established safety procedures.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Receive and perform work assignments, oral and\u002For written from Group Leader, Team Leader, or Managers and work with or under the direction of engineers and contractors as needed. Accurately report findings of inspections to operations, Group Leader, etc.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Document, organize, and retain all findings of evaluations and inspections in a timely manner.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Interpret drawings, sketches, etc. to determine necessary tools and materials needed for assignments.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Perform preventive electrical maintenance and routine repairs on all equipment and operating systems within the facility, including electrical boxes, wires, switches, gearboxes, transmissions, hydraulic &amp; lubrication systems, injection, heating, and assembly equipment.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Perform inspections on lifting equipment such as chains, cables, shackles, eyebolts, clamps, and lifting beams to determine the safe operating condition.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Maintain records as required. Verify dimensions as needed.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Keep work areas in a clean and orderly condition.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Return tools to proper storage location at conclusion of job\u002Fshift operations.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Utilize Lean and 5S principles. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv> Dismantles, repairs, assembles, installs and sets up mechanic equipment and mechanic parts of production machines used in a production site.\n <div>\n   Position Overview\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Perform installation, repairs, preventive maintenance, and alterations to complex machinery, machine tools, lifting equipment, and fixtures. Record all required data of repairs and installations. Interpret and implement corrective actions from prints, drawings, and verbal instructions. Recommend appropriate corrective action in accordance with referenced specifications, accepted industry and shop practices. Perform mechanical construction work as required.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Job Responsibilities\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The following are the major job duties but this job description does not preclude the performance of other duties by the incumbent.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Receive and perform work assignments, oral and\u002For written and follow work instructions.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Accurately report findings of inspections to operations, supervisor, etc. Document, organize, and retain all findings of evaluations and inspections in a timely manner.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Interpret drawings, sketches, etc. to determine necessary tools and materials needed for assignments.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Perform preventive maintenance and routine repairs on all equipment and operating systems within the facility, including gearboxes, transmissions, hydraulic &amp; lubrication systems, injection, heating, and molding equipment.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Perform inspections on lifting equipment such as chains, cables, shackles, eyebolts, clamps, and lifting beams to determine the safe operating condition.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Maintain records as required. Fabricate, weld, and braze materials as needed.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Install piping and conduit as needed.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Enter and maintain data as needed for operating maintenance work order and log systems.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Work with or under the direction of supervisors, engineers, and contractors as needed.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Assemble, verify dimensions, and disassemble components or set-ups as required.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Use all required safety equipment and follow established safety procedures.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Provide technical direction and training for lower classifications as required.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Keep work areas in a clean and orderly condition.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Return tools to proper storage location at conclusion of job\u002Fshift operations.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Support and apply team concepts in daily activities\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Required Knowledge\u002FSkill, Education and Experience\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Within the qualifying period the employee must demonstrate a satisfactory proficiency in maintenance repair.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Must demonstrate skills in print reading and application\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     High School Diploma or equivalent\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Passing score on General Aptitude test or A 2-year technical degree or equivalent experience required.\n <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Overview:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Field Service Technician positions now available the Coyote Wind Farm in Snyder Texas, Scurry County . This is a 3 years service contract for (48) SG145s and (11) 2.415-108s wind turbine generators. The Field Service Technician will perform planned and unplanned maintenance including troubleshooting and replacement of parts if necessary in a safe and professional manner on Wind Turbines. Detailed records and parts used must be completed for all work performed. Technicians report to site management and communicate needs and or safety issues that arise. Perform first class work on preventive maintenance to be completed on time and right the first time.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Driving is an essential function of the job and applicants must have a valid drivers license at the time of application with an acceptable driving record. Employees must maintain a valid license and acceptable driving record and may be subject to periodic DMV checks of their license.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Relocation will not be offered for this role\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Performs mainly pre-defined, technical tasks (for example, basic commissioning of products and systems, integration of components to a system, basic engineering, maintenance jobs) and work packages on-site and remotely.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Supports customer remotely and onsite, and provides 2nd and 3rd level user support in case of arising issues.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Coordinates and accomplishes defined service operations and\u002For resolves product issues for customers equipment.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Supports in regulations.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Site level communication with the customer.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Perform downtime allocations as per the <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Ability to work a flexible work schedule is required, along with the ability to analyze and resolve issues independently and efficiently.\n It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv> Takes responsibility for the development, exploitation and maximization of the account penetration and profitable growth of assigned key customers for one or more organizational units in a country or region.\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> Sales Regional Account Manager<\u002Fi>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Overview\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We are looking for a highly motivated and customer-focused Sales professional to lead commercial activities related to the sale of renewable energy products (wind turbines, service, etc.) within Texas &amp; Southwest region. Successful candidates will have the ability to execute the complete sales process including the management of proposal generation, strategy development, customer relationship management and contract negotiation. This is a client facing position wherein a candidate will represent Siemens Gamesa for all account \u002F commercial activities. Positive, persistent, self-motivated and action-oriented candidates with demonstrated transaction experience are required.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities\n <\u002Fdiv>\n relationships with existing customer base within the assigned region, while seeking to develop and grow new customers and associated relationships.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Support Customer with technical and commercial data on Siemens Gamesa offerings, including presentations, Indicative Offers and involvement from Technical Sales and Marketing, as needed.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Generate knowledge on the customer's specific strategy and its political and business environment.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Generate and evaluate of sales leads and business opportunities with assigned clients and\u002For region.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develop negotiation strategy, management of value oriented offers and RFP responses, leading activities to successful conclusion.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Manage customer complaints as point of escalation, if necessary.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Coordinate customer actions with the Global Account Manager (where applicable)<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> Own the customer and sales opportunities throughout the Sales Process within Siemens Gamesa\n   <ul>\n    <li> direct and prioritize the activities of a multi-functional team within you will be responsible for coordination of contract obligations and claims management\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n    Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy Limited has a flexible work arrangement policy.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n    Essential Duties &amp; Responsibilities:\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul>\n   <li> For complex contracts and customer claims, ensures adherence to contract terms and full claim recovery<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Performs contract analysis\u002Freading and presents Contract and Claim Strategy for portfolio<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Prepares and Updates project claim strategy defining fundamental objectives, roles, responsibilities and processes for claim management in agreement with project team<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Participates in project hand-over, risk and opportunities meetings, project status meetings (internal and external) and internal approval processes (SBA) during the project execution phase when necessary and called upon by the PM<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support in identify and advising on risks and opportunities<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Together with the project planner, monitors schedule changes against contractual key dates \u002F milestones to avoid liquidated damages or enable revenue share.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> In the event of a claim, ensures contractual notice periods are adhered to<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Consults with and seeks advice from legal department in case of ambiguity or interpretation issues of contract clauses<\u002Fli>\n   <li> In order to identify, pursue, or defend potential claims, CIM reviews event information, advises the team on the need for further records or preservation of evidence<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Supports claim owner in notifying, assessing, assessing\u002Fdefending, negotiating and monitoring identified claims and in preparing and conducting claim negotiations<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Supports legal department in case of Dispute resolution and arbitration \u002F court proceedings<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Other Special Projects as assigned<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Person can work from home\u002Fremotely<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n    Required skills, experience, and education:\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Overview\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Join one of the worlds leading suppliers of wind power solutions as a Wind Technician for Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy! Demand for electricity generated from renewable sources is growing fast, and Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy has the answers. As one of the market leaders, we combine technological innovations, experience, and expertise to deliver readily available, one-stop solutions and have a proven track record of successfully delivering wind power projects on all continents. SGRE is currently seeking highly talented and motivated candidates for a Wind Technician position. The candidate will work together with a multi-disciplinary group to ensure top performance on our wind farms. The ideal candidate has the ability to work a flexible schedule, along with the ability to analyze and resolve problems independently and efficiently. S\u002Fhe will provide excellent service to our customers, have the ability to work on complex systems in challenging environments, and participate in the development of new field procedures and best practices.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Relocation may be offered for this role should it be necessary.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Essential Duties &amp; tasks (for example, basic commissioning of products and systems, integration of components to a system, basic engineering, maintenance jobs) and work packages on-site and remotely.\n <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Overview\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Join one of the worlds leading suppliers of wind power solutions as a Wind Site Manager for Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy! Demand for electricity generated from renewable sources is growing fast, and Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy has the answers. As one of the market leaders, we combine technological innovations, experience, and expertise to deliver readily available, one-stop solutions and have a proven track record of successfully delivering wind power projects on all continents. SGRE is currently seeking highly talented and motivated candidates for a Wind Site Manager position. The candidate will work together with a multi-disciplinary group to ensure top performance on our wind farms. The ideal candidate will have demonstrated results\u002Fexperience in the following areas: Employee Health &amp; Safety, Project Management, Performance Management, Staffing, Training assessments, Quality, Compliance, Financial Management, Customer Orientation, and Risk Management. This position will have commercial responsibility for successful on-site operations, drive continuous process improvements, and hold overall responsibility for site performance\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Additionally, the Site Manager position requires the candidate to be able to ascend to heights up to 250 feet or greater, work in confined spaces, discern colors and meet body weight restrictions of 265 pounds. A medical practitioner will assess successful candidates to ensure they meet these requirements at all times during their employment.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Relocation may be offered for this role should it be necessary.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Ensures adherence to defined guidelines, processes, and procedures, for all site operations assigned.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Oversees completion of site administration according to performance standards agreed (on schedule, at requisite quality level, on-budget).\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Assumes economic responsibility, e.g., calculates material, personnel, and running contract costs for suppliers.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Represents the site in all decision-making committees of the project (towards own management, customer, and team).\n <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Overview\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The Project Manager of Special Projects - Reports to the North American Service Operations Project Management Office and is responsible for managing external customer projects - aftermarket-based projects. The project manager will direct multiple small to medium projects and at least one large and very complex project. The project will be managed from pre-sale\u002Fhandover through planning and execution to project closure.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Sole responsibility of the project from implementation through completion.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Help define project scope, goals, and deliverables during pre-sales<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Develop full-scale project plans and associated communications documents.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Monitor project performance to ensure the team stays on the approved timeline, manage the global project team, manage budget performance, identify risks involved in a project and mitigate those risks.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Establish milestones and monitor adherence to master plans and schedules.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Liaise with project stakeholders on an ongoing basis.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide project revenue reports and profit forecasts as regular project status updates.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Estimate the resources and participants needed to achieve project goals.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide regular updates to team, management, and PMO on work performed, schedule, budget, and overall status.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support the preparation of proposals, business plans, work statements, specifications, operating budgets, and financial terms\u002Fconditions of contract.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Identify parts list as needed per work scope.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Proactively assist Sales, Marketing, and Field Service in order solicitation (planning, identifying, quoting, ordering, and BOM interpretation)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Able to research technical records to provide parts clarification.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Apply PM@SGRE methodology.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Maintain cross-functional\u002FP&amp;L interfaces and utilize skills such as the ability to ask penetrating questions, detect unstated assumptions, and resolve conflicts.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Be self-motivated and can forecast risks and challenges.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Have the ability to multitask.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Drive a high-performance culture through strong leadership and effective team management using varied resources across multiple departments and organizations.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> As part of the Service Operations Project Management Team, help define the future portfolio of Wind Services.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Relocation may be offered for this role should it be necessary.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Qualified applicants may be allowed remote working opportunities, based on business needs.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Required <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Overview\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   For our Project Coordination department, we are currently looking for a Project Coordinator for Offshore Execution to join our team in Orlando, Florida.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How to contribute to our vision\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The Project Coordination department is responsible for assisting the Project Manager and project execution team on internal and external daily project business topics. The Project Coordinator sets up and maintains a correspondence system for the execution project, supports in administrative and project-related IT programs, guides in process excellence performance on the project. The Project Coordinator establishes and drives Lessons Learned culture in the execution project.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As a Project Coordinator you will be supporting the project manager and the project teams in our offshore execution projects with a variety of tasks related to daily business topics e.g. prepare reports and briefings for internal and external stakeholders as well as schedule, prepare and accompany appointments and meetings and complete minutes of meetings and follow up on project task lists.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Relocation will not be offered for this role.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Furthermore, you have the responsibility for the correspondence management in the project. This includes supporting the project manager in maintaining a project communication plan, a communication matrix, describe the communication flow internally and externally and to set up a project mailbox or correspondence system.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     You will establish and drive Lessons Learned culture in the execution project (e.g. facilitate Lessons Learned workshops, handle documentation of learnings during the project execution).\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Overall, you will provide support to the entire project team - both on IT administration tasks, onboarding new project team members, creating and maintaining internal and external project organizational charts and manage the access to all project-related contracts.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     You will be site Administrator for project Workpoint site.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Additionally, you will work closely with the Hub Head and support in scheduling and facilitating PM office meetings, taking minutes of meeting, maintaining the US hub Sharepoint site. You will be first point of contact regarding offshore project management topics in Orlando office.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Required Knowledge\u002F Skills, Education, and Experience\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Besides a passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change, we are also looking for:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   A person who is service minded, flexible and bring energy to the team. You are the natural center of support for the entire project team and you enjoy a working day with many different tasks and proactively bring solutions to the table. You like to work with IT tools and processes, ready to pick up tasks outside your scope when necessary. You have an eye for details and your work approach is very structured. You deliver your tasks punctually.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Furthermore, it is an advantage if you are\u002Fhave:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Experienced user of Office 365 and Sharepoint\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Educational background within administration, linguistics\u002Ftranslation, IT or commercial\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Experience working in a large multinational company is an advantage\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Skilled communicator with excellent command of English both orally and in writing\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Some travel must be expected.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> In case you have acquired your skills in alternative ways your application is just as well appreciated.<\u002Fi>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In return of your commitment we offer you\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come. We are a global team of diverse colleagues who share a passion for renewable energy and have a culture of trust and empowerment to make our own ideas a reality. We focus on personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization. Siemens Gamesa offers a wide variety of benefits such as flexible working hours as well as home-office possibility for many colleagues, employer-funded pension, attractive remuneration package (fixed\u002Fvariable) and local benefits such as subsided lunch, employee discounts and much more.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy has a progressive approach to working in a digital environment and our flexible working policies mean that many of our employees choose to work from home for a substantial portion of the working month. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The Wind Service Technician positions are Available in Western, NE (Milligan Wind Farm - SW of Lincoln); Abilene, TX (King Creek Wind Farm); and Maljamar, NM (Oso Grande Wind Farm - NW of Hobbs)\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Overview\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Join one of the worlds leading suppliers of wind power solutions as a Wind Technician for Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy! Demand for electricity generated from renewable sources is growing fast, and Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy has the answers. As one of the market leaders, we combine technological innovations, experience, and expertise to deliver readily available, one-stop solutions and have a proven track record of successfully delivering wind power projects on all continents. SGRE is currently seeking highly talented and motivated candidates for a Wind Technician position. The candidate will work together with a multi-disciplinary group to ensure top performance on our wind farms. The ideal candidate has the ability to work a flexible schedule, along with the ability to analyze and resolve problems independently and efficiently. The candidate will provide excellent service to our customers, have the ability to work on complex systems in challenging environments, and participate in the development of new field procedures and best practices.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Travel up to 100% in the first six to twelve month of employment (OJT and Training), followed by up to 20% in the following years.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Performs mainly pre-defined, technical tasks (for example, basic commissioning of products and systems, integration of components to a system, basic engineering, maintenance jobs) and work packages on-site and remotely.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Supports customer remotely and onsite, and provides 2nd and 3rd level user support in case of arising issues.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Coordinates and accomplishes defined service operations and\u002For resolves product issues for customers equipment.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Adheres to defined processes and applicable regulations.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to analyze and resolve problems independently and efficiently.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide excellent service to our customers.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Work in stressful, dangerous situations, and participate in the development of new field procedures and best practices Actively work on wind power projects.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Flexible travel schedule. Complete and maintain required and accurate documentation and records.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Flexibility to work outside planned hours, including nights and weekends as needed and on-call<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Work in varying temperature conditions, and adverse weather conditions<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Required Knowledge\u002F Skills, Education, and Experience\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> High school diploma or equivalent<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must have minimum of 6 months experience in a mechanical, electrical or industrial field<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must meet body weight restrictions of 265 pounds or less as required by the safety regulations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Flexible travel schedule<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Driving is an essential function of the job and applicants must have a valid drivers license at the time of application with an acceptable driving record. Employees must maintain a valid license and acceptable driving record and may be subject to periodic DMV checks of their license.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Physically and mentally able to work suspended from heights and in confined spaces<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must pass a physical administered by a medical practitioner to ensure ability to safely perform the job functions and meet the physical demands of the position<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must pass pre-hire background drug screening<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Qualified applicants must be legally authorized for employment in the United States. Qualified applicants will not require employer sponsored work authorization now or in the future for employment in the United States<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Preferred Knowledge\u002F Skills, Education, and Experience\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Certification from a Renewable Energy or Wind Technical Program<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Hands on work experience as a Wind Technician on a Wind Farm<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience on Gamesa or Siemens platforms<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience\u002Fknowledge of NERC<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Knowledge of critical infrastructure<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Relevant work experience e.g. electrical, mechanical, hydraulic, maintenance\u002Ftroubleshooting in a military, industrial, aviation or automotive industry<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   #entrylevel #midlevel #troubleshooter #windtech\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Equal Employment Opportunity Statement\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   HR Business Partner\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Leading the way forward in the renewable energy sector, Siemens Gamesa provides cleaner, more reliable and more affordable wind power. Our scale, global reach and proven track record ensure that we will play a central role in shaping the energy landscape of the future. We currently have the following opportunity available for a Human Resources Business Partner located in Hutchinson, Kansas.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Overview:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The Human Resources Business Partner will effectively partner with US Division and Business Unit leaders to execute human resources strategies in direct support of annual business objectives. The successful candidate acts as an employee champion and change agent. This role is to support the Hutchinson, Kansas production facility.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Implements HR strategy and guidelines within the assigned organization(s)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Aligns the regional HR activities with the business requirements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Collaborates with Human Resources Business Partners and Center of Expertise to execute projects and drive integration<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Maintains in-depth knowledge of legal requirements related to day-to-day management of employees, reducing legal risks and ensuring regulatory compliance. Partners with the legal department as needed\u002Frequired<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensures that the assigned organization(s) benefits from overall HR corporate programs and services including but not limited to recruiting, talent development, performance management and shared services<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Sets up and executes unit HR projects<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Leads employee relations initiatives and investigations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Builds in structure and processes related to employee evaluations, merit, and succession planning<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Assists employees to resolve issues and answer questions related to policies, HR initiatives, pay and benefits<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Partners with supervisors and managers to create HR strategies that help move the business forward and address any issues<\u002Fli>\n  <li> There could be up to 10% travel with this position<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Relocation will not be offered for this role<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Required Knowledge\u002FSkills, Education and Experience:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> 5+ years of human resources experience; including experience supporting factory employees in a manufacturing environment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Bachelors degree or equivalent combination of education and experience required<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Excellent written and verbal communication, relationship building, multi-tasking, organizational, presentation, collaboration, follow-up, and negotiating skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Demonstrated experience establishing customer relationships and a track record of outstanding customer satisfaction<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Knowledge working in HR platforms<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Positive change maker with a strong ability to challenge the status quo<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience managing or coordinating projects<\u002Fli>\n  <li> MS Office (Word, Excel, Power Point)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Qualified applicants must be legally authorized for employment in the United States. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Overview\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     In Site Resource Sourcing (SRS) we are looking for a Construction Site Coordinator who has the motivation and ability to work a flexible work schedule. The Construction Site Coordinator manages typical administrative tasks on a construction site and reports functionally to the Site Management and disciplinary to the Team Lead in the back office. The CSC acts as a central point of contact and interacts with all stakeholders involved in the project execution.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Dimension of function :The CSC contributes to the safe execution of projects on site on behalf of Site Management. The CSC is primarily responsible for the daily planning and execution within individual area and functions of the construction site, as directed by the Site Manager. By joining our team, you will be our Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy staff colleague and you will be part of our very enthusiastic and dedicated Site Resource Sourcing (SRS) group represented in Denmark, Germany, UK, The Netherlands, France, Taiwan and US.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Stakeholders :The CSC is a key interface to all Site Team members, visitors, clients, and back office and must always maintain good relationships. The CSC is authorized to make corrections, changes, or rejections within the assigned area of responsibility to ensure compliance with and adherence to SGRE procedures and policies.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Mobility &amp; work pattern :We are looking for a candidate who has the motivation and ability to work a flexible work schedule. The CSC position mostly works in rotation patterns of 2 weeks on\u002F2 weeks off. This means you need to be willing and able to relocate to site locations in the US in accordance with this rotation pattern. Depending on the site location, it could also be a potential relocation for a shorter period  even outside of the US.And finally, we could also be looking at periods of time where you will be working a Monday to Friday shift.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Relocation will not be offered for this role.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Collect and verify different data from multiple sources, consolidate various data reports, as DPRs, and distribute to relevant stakeholders. Provide feedback to data owner in case of deviations. Monitor, verify and correct reports prior to submittal, such as time registration overviews, KPI reports, vendor reports, crew change lists, etc.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Arrange transport and accommodation for site personnel travelling to\u002Ffrom Project in line with Project specific transport concept. Organize and manage crew changes to\u002Ffrom specific site location by producing crew change manifests per defined format based on manning plans. Coordinate with Site Management and Marine Coordinator and update transport manifests.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Act as first point of contact towards visitors and site personnel to\u002Ffrom site, as receptionist including reporting, data entry, keeping visitor log and answering phone calls.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Organize, arrange, and coordinate meetings on site. Prepare, distribute, and file meeting minutes.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Comply with the Environment, Health &amp; Safety rules on Site. Active support through participation in toolbox talks and safety campaigns.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Track stock of office supplies and place orders when necessary. Support with ad hoc clerical tasks.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     PO creation and budget checking when necessary (if Project requests it).\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Update and maintain records and databases, such as personnel data\u002Fcertificates\u002Fqualifications \u002Ftraining details into internal or customer system after verification of validity and of compliance.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Execute Site administrative activities and operations to secure efficiency and compliance with company policies.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Assist and train colleagues when necessary.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Willing to work through holidays, when necessary.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     The role requires flexibility to travel as needed.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    Required knowledge, skills &amp; Education\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n    A passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. In addition to this we are also looking for:\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n      Expert within business administration - structured and organized\n    <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n      Advanced communication skills in multicultural environments\n    <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n      English language proficiency\n    <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n      Customer-oriented and service-minded\n    <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n      Advanced IT Skills - MS Outlook, Office 365 (Word, Excel, OneDrive). Not required but beneficial: SAP (SRP)\n    <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n      Team player\n    <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n      Self-motivated and trustworthy\n    <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n      Schedule and time management\n    <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n      Quality oriented\n    <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n      Safety awareness\n    <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n      Analysis\u002Fstatistics\n    <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n      Other beneficial skills\u002Fexperiences: knowledge and interest in industry - wind turbine industry, construction projects\n    <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n      Professional - proven experience as office \u002F business administrator, assistant, or relevant role. Qualifications in secretarial studies will be an advantage.\n    <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n      Project\u002FProcess - familiarity with office management procedures and preferably within the Offshore Wind Industry.\n    <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n      Intercultural - living and working experience in an intercultural environment.\n    <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n      Ability to Learn\n    <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n      Communication Skills\n    <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n      Customer Focus\n    <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n      Detail-oriented\n    <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n      Adaptable\n    <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    #Associate\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n    In return of your commitment, we offer you\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <ul>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n      Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come\n    <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n      A global team of diverse colleagues who share passion for renewable energy\n    <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n      Trust and empowerment to make your own ideas reality\n    <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n      Personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization\n    <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   To learn more about Siemens Gamesa, check out these videos:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    Empowering our people\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n     https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <br> How do you imagine the future?\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n     https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    Equal Employment Opportunity Statement\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n    Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. As one of the market leaders, we combine technological innovations, experience, and expertise to deliver readily available, one-stop solutions and have a proven track record of successfully delivering wind power projects on all continents. SGRE is currently seeking highly talented and motivated candidates for a Wind Technician position. The candidate will work together with a multi-disciplinary group to ensure top performance on our wind farms. The ideal candidate has the ability to work a flexible schedule, along with the ability to analyze and resolve problems independently and efficiently. S\u002Fhe will provide excellent service to our customers, have the ability to work on complex systems in challenging environments, and participate in the development of new field procedures and best practices.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Relocation may be offered for this role should it be necessary.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Essential Duties &amp; <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Overview:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Siemens Wind Power and Gamesa have recently merged to create a leader in the renewable energy industry, to provide cleaner, more reliable and more affordable energy to society, and to create lasting value for all stakeholders. With a worldwide installed capacity of 75 GW, Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy has a presence in more than 90 countries and a team of 27,000 employees worldwide. Its end-to-end value chain presence encompasses onshore and offshores wind turbines design, manufacturing, installation as well as cutting-edge service solutions. The global headquarters and legal domicile of the company is located in Zamudio, Spain. The company is listed on the Spanish stock exchange.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     We are now recruiting Commissioning Technicians and Technical Supervisors to join our team.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     As an Offshore Commissioning Technician, you will be part of a permanently employed team who are dedicated and responsible for the installation and commissioning of wind turbine projects in line with safety guidelines, project requirements, corporate methods and industry legislative standards.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     SGRE is based in Orlando, USA, you can however be deployed to projects worldwide including (EU and APAC). The role will provide you with lots of variety, learning and development opportunities along with an exceptional team culture. You will follow a shift pattern therefore a flexible approach to travel and working away from home on a continuing basis is essential. We offer a competitive basic salary, generous holiday allowance, bonus scheme, and contributory pension.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Relocation will not be offered for this role\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Perform, supervise, train and ensure safety during all phases of Wind Turbine Installation.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Prepare transition piece, tools, equipment and components during loadout and installation, as well as perform closure of punch lists during installation\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Keep and maintain accurate logbooks, documentation and reports as required by company policy\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Supervise and conduct the training of new colleagues \u002F 3rd party employees\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Ensure that work is conducted according to the defined workflow and work instructions\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Act as signaler in accordance with work instructions, checklists and lift plans\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Lead small teams\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Keep up to date with all required training as defined by your role profile.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Required Knowledge, Skills, Education, Experience and Abilities\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     The ideal candidate for this role will have hands on experience of all aspects of Wind Turbine Installation including Slinging, Signaling, Mechanical Completion, Retrofit &amp; Snagging works. In addition, knowledge of Low Voltage Electrical systems and isolation procedures, preferably in the form of a recognized qualification whilst not essential would be a distinct advantage.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     This role requires a high level of Health and Safety focus with experience of working with safe systems of work. You will demonstrate the ability to work as part of a team and\u002For on own initiative and have the ability and confidence to work at height. This includes appropriate physical fitness to climb and undertake some physical work. You will also be comfortable and experienced working in adverse weather conditions.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     2+yrs of commissioning experience\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Candidates must be able and willing to frequently travel to within the United States of America, to Canada and occasionally internationally.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Demonstrates and applies advanced knowledge of concepts, practices, and procedures for area managed and good knowledge of other areas in the company and how they interact.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Demonstrates full understanding and application of management approaches for work direction, motivation, and performance management\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Qualified applicants must be legally authorized for employment in the United States. Qualified applicants will not require employer sponsored work authorization now or in the future for employment in the United States\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     You will be a strong communicator with proven ability to successfully interact at various levels in an organization and where necessary considering different cultures.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     You will also have a high level of IT literacy e.g using digital technology, communications tools, and\u002For networks to access, manage, integrate, evaluate, and create information\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   #Associate\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Preferred Knowledge, Skills, Education, Experience and Abilities\n As one of the market leaders, we combine technological innovations, experience, and expertise to deliver readily available, one-stop solutions and have a proven track record of successfully delivering wind power projects on all continents. SGRE is currently seeking highly talented and motivated candidates for a Wind Technician position. The candidate will work together with a multi-disciplinary group to ensure top performance on our wind farms. The ideal candidate has the ability to work a flexible schedule, along with the ability to analyze and resolve problems independently and efficiently. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Overview\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Join one of the worlds leading suppliers of wind power solutions as a Wind Technician for Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy! Demand for electricity generated from renewable sources is growing fast, and Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy has the answers. As one of the market leaders, we combine technological innovations, experience, and expertise to deliver readily available, one-stop solutions and have a proven track record of successfully delivering wind power projects on all continents. SGRE is currently seeking highly talented and motivated candidates for a Wind Technician position. The candidate will work together with a multi-disciplinary group to ensure top performance on our wind farms. The ideal candidate has the ability to work a flexible schedule, along with the ability to analyze and resolve problems independently and efficiently. S\u002Fhe will provide excellent service to our customers, have the ability to work on complex systems in challenging environments, and participate in the development of new field procedures and best practices.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The Wind Service Technician position is located in OSO Grande, New Mexico\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Relocation may be offered for this role should it be necessary.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Service and maintenance wind turbines\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Troubleshoot errors on wind turbine\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Escalate technical issues to supporting engineering functions\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Be self-motivated, able to think quickly and address issues as they arise\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Ability to work a flexible work schedule is required, along with the ability to analyze and resolve issues independently and efficiently\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Required Knowledge\u002F Skills, Education, and Experience\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Driving is an essential function of the job and applicants must have a valid drivers license at the time of application with an acceptable driving record. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Join one of the worlds leading suppliers of wind power solutions as a Wind Technician for Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy! Demand for electricity generated from renewable sources is growing fast, and Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy has the answers. As one of the market leaders, we combine technological innovations, experience, and expertise to deliver readily available, one-stop solutions and have a proven track record of successfully delivering wind power projects on all continents. SGRE is currently seeking highly talented and motivated candidates for a Wind Technician position. The candidate will work together with a multi-disciplinary group to ensure top performance on our wind farms. The ideal candidate has the ability to work a flexible schedule, along with the ability to analyze and resolve problems independently and efficiently. S\u002Fhe will provide excellent service to our customers, have the ability to work on complex systems in challenging environments, and participate in the development of new field procedures and best practices.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Travel up to 10% in the first year of employment.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Relocation may be offered for this role should it be necessary.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Essential Duties &amp; <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Wind Technician- Service Technician\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Overview\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Join one of the worlds leading suppliers of wind power solutions as a Wind Technician for Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy! Demand for electricity generated from renewable sources is growing fast, and Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy has the answers. As one of the market leaders, we combine technological innovations, experience, and expertise to deliver readily available, one-stop solutions and have a proven track record of successfully delivering wind power projects on all continents. SGRE is currently seeking highly talented and motivated candidates for a Wind Technician position. The candidate will work together with a multi-disciplinary group to ensure top performance on our wind farms. The ideal candidate has the ability to work a flexible schedule, along with the ability to analyze and resolve problems independently and efficiently. S\u002Fhe will provide excellent service to our customers, have the ability to work on complex systems in challenging environments, and participate in the development of new field procedures and best practices.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Essential Duties &amp; Responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Service and maintenance wind turbines<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Troubleshoot errors on wind turbine<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Escalate technical issues to supporting engineering functions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Perform mainly pre-defined, technical tasks (for example, basic commissioning of products and systems, integration of components to a system, basic engineering, maintenance jobs) and work packages on-site and remotely.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support customer remotely and onsite and provides 2nd and 3rd level user support in case of arising issues.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Coordinates and accomplishes defined service operations and\u002For resolves product issues for customers equipment.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Supports in generating sales leads for pre-defined service offers and contributes to planning activities.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Adheres to defined processes and applicable regulations.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Be self-motivated, able to think quickly and address issues as they arise<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to work a flexible work schedule is required, along with the ability to analyze and resolve issues independently and efficiently.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Required Knowledge\u002F Skills, Education, and Experience\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Driving is an essential function of the job and applicants must have a valid drivers license at the time of application with an acceptable driving record. Employees must maintain a valid license and acceptable driving record and may be subject to periodic DMV checks of their license.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must have minimum of 3 Years experience in a mechanical, electrical or industrial field<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Physically and mentally able to work suspended from heights and in confined spaces<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Flexible travel schedule<\u002Fli>\n  <li> High school diploma or equivalent<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must meet body weight restrictions of 265 pounds or less as required by the safety regulations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must pass a physical administered by a medical practitioner to ensure ability to safely perform the job functions and meet the physical demands of the position<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must pass pre-hire background drug screening<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Qualified applicants must be legally authorized for employment in the United States. Qualified applicants will not require employer sponsored work authorization now or in the future for employment in the United States<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Preferred Knowledge\u002F Skills, Education, and Experience\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Certification from a Renewable Energy or Wind Technical Program<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Hands on work experience as a Wind Technician on a Wind Farm<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Should have completed Trouble shooting training or tech 2 training.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Relocation is not approved for this role.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Sponsoring a visa is not approved for this role.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div>\n   #Entry\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   To learn more about Siemens Gamesa, check out these videos:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How do you imagine the future?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Equal Employment Opportunity Statement\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Summary:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     The Wind Service Technician performs planned and unplanned maintenance including troubleshooting and replacement of parts if necessary, in a safe and professional manner on Wind Turbines. Detailed records and parts used must be completed for all work performed. Technicians report to site management and communicate needs and or safety issues that arise. Perform first class work on preventive maintenance to be completed on time and right the first time.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Relocation will be offered for this role.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Essential Duties &amp; Responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Performs mainly pre-defined, technical tasks (for example, basic commissioning of products and systems, integration of components to a system, basic engineering, maintenance jobs) and work packages on-site and remotely.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Supports customer remotely and onsite, and provides 2nd and 3rd level user support in case of arising issues.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Coordinates and accomplishes defined service operations and\u002For resolves product issues for customers equipment.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Supports in generating sales leads for pre-defined service offers and contributes to planning activities.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Adheres to defined processes and applicable regulations.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Ability to analyze and resolve problems independently and efficiently.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Provide excellent service to our customers.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Work in stressful, dangerous situations, and participate in the development of new field procedures and best practices Actively work on wind power projects.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Flexible travel schedule up to 10-25% travel. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Join one of the worlds leading suppliers of wind power solutions as a Wind Technician for Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy! Demand for electricity generated from renewable sources is growing fast, and Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy has the answers. As one of the market leaders, we combine technological innovations, experience, and expertise to deliver readily available, one-stop solutions and have a proven track record of successfully delivering wind power projects on all continents. SGRE is currently seeking highly talented and motivated candidates for a Wind Technician position. The candidate will work together with a multi-disciplinary group to ensure top performance on our wind farms. The ideal candidate has the ability to work a flexible schedule, along with the ability to analyze and resolve problems independently and efficiently. S\u002Fhe will provide excellent service to our customers, have the ability to work on complex systems in challenging environments, and participate in the development of new field procedures and best practices.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Relocation may be offered for this role should it be necessary.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Essential Duties &amp; At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Overview\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Join one of the worlds leading suppliers of wind power solutions as a Wind Technician for Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy! Demand for electricity generated from renewable sources is growing fast, and Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy has the answers. As one of the market leaders, we combine technological innovations, experience, and expertise to deliver readily available, one-stop solutions and have a proven track record of successfully delivering wind power projects on all continents. SGRE is currently seeking highly talented and motivated candidates for a Wind Technician position. The candidate will work together with a multi-disciplinary group to ensure top performance on our wind farms. The ideal candidate has the ability to work a flexible schedule, along with the ability to analyze and resolve problems independently and efficiently. S\u002Fhe will provide excellent service to our customers, have the ability to work on complex systems in challenging environments, and participate in the development of new field procedures and best <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Site Manager  Offshore Construction\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy (SGRE) is a leader in the renewable energy industry, providing cleaner, more reliable and more affordable energy to society and whilst creating lasting value for all stakeholders. With a worldwide installed capacity of 89 GW, SGRE has a presence in more than 90 countries and a team of 23,000 employees worldwide. Its end-to-end value chain presence encompasses onshore and offshores wind turbines design, manufacturing, installation as well as cutting-edge service solutions. The global headquarters and legal domicile of the company is located in Zamudio, Spain. The company is listed on the Spanish stock exchange.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We are now recruiting for a Site Manager position for Offshore Construction. The primary purpose of this role will be the responsibility and authority for the safe and economical execution of the works at a specific construction site location. This role reports to the Head of Site Management and Installation Leads (SMIL).\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What are my responsibilities?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The Site Manager has the directive and decision-making authority for all operations at the construction site location as well as towards all personnel present at that location. The Site Manager reports directly to the project responsible Lead Site Manager on a daily basis and functionally to the Head of SMIL.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You will in accordance with the contract and EHS \u002F QA systems be responsible for the planning and execution of works at a specific location of the construction site as directed by the Lead Site Manager. You will ensure that all work is performed in agreement with all SGRE standards and regulations. You will perform continuous evaluation and feedback of the individuals within your teams to ensure capabilities and skills are maintained and where necessary improved to the required standards. You will ensure the implementation, continuous improvement and optimizing of processes, workflows and standards to standardize execution and create a safe working environment.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Some of your key tasks will include but not be limited to:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Provide visible, strong and active EHS leadership within the project, acting as a champion of Zero Harm. Responsible to ensure the issuance of EHS standards, regulations and procedures to ensure a Zero Harm environment and to perform within your leading function as a role model.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Support and contribute to EHS matters in the various planning meetings during the project planning phase and then ensuring the assessment, documentation and certification process are in place during the project execution phase.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Responsible for ensuring that activities at site comply with company and project targets in regard to safety, schedule, cost and quality. In case of deviations then responsible for developing and implementing countermeasures whilst providing transparency for early warnings for escalation and reporting.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Responsible for the implementation and execution of change and claim management, as well as cost out measures, ensuring that the quality of work undertaken results in no additional non-standard work, by driving a Zero Defect culture in all areas.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Responsible for risk and opportunity management.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Ensure the planning and coordination of all site activities and establish and implement a regular reporting regime.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Responsible for the site setup planning, mobilization and demobilization of the construction site location and in accordance with requirements the maintenance of tools, equipment and machinery during execution.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Responsible for the implementation of 24ONE99 workflows and related construction standards and cost out measures.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   What do I need to qualify for this role?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The successful candidate will either have a University degree in a relevant subject and \u002F or have +6 years of professional experience in the Offshore wind industry and +2 years in a similar role.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You will be an experienced leader with proven track record in large international construction projects and possessing in-depth technical knowledge of wind turbine products and related logistics. You will be able to handle conflicts and be a solution orientated individual who can understand technical issues, work processes and activities at site and who is a team player able to maintain high performing teams.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   You will have a solid understanding of the work processes at project sites, with broad planning, production, assembly and commissioning know-how as well as in-depth knowledge of business planning and the business process. You will also be EHS and Quality focused and be able to identify risks before they happen and have solid knowledge and understanding of SGRE Sphera, QA and EHS processes.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   To be successful in this role, you will have excellent communication skills, both written and verbal  advanced in the English language. Lastly, as this role requires you to work and be based at our project sites globally, you will be willing and able to travel anywhere as required, working on a rotational basis both onshore and offshore.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   #Mid -Senior level\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   To learn more about Siemens Gamesa, check out these videos:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How do you imagine the future?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Equal Employment Opportunity Statement\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, creed, religion, national origin, citizenship status, ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability unrelated to ability, marital status, pregnancy, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity, transgender, sex stereotyping, order of protection status, protected veteran or military status, or an unfavorable discharge from military service, and other categories protected by federal, state or local law.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   EEO is the Law\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Applicants and employees are protected under Federal law from discrimination. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Overview\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Join one of the worlds leading suppliers of wind power solutions as a Wind Site Manager for Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy! Demand for electricity generated from renewable sources is growing fast, and Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy has the answers. As one of the market leaders, we combine technological innovations, experience, and expertise to deliver readily available, one-stop solutions and have a proven track record of successfully delivering wind power projects on all continents. SGRE is currently seeking highly talented and motivated candidates for a Wind Site Manager position. The candidate will work together with a multi-disciplinary group to ensure top performance on our wind farms. The ideal candidate will have demonstrated results\u002Fexperience in the following areas: Employee Health &amp; Safety, Project Management, Performance Management, Staffing, Training assessments, Quality, Compliance, Financial Management, Customer Orientation, and Risk Management. This position will have commercial responsibility for successful on-site operations, drive continuous process improvements, and hold overall responsibility for site performance\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Additionally, the Site Manager position requires the candidate to be able to ascend to heights up to 250 feet or greater, work in confined spaces, discern colors and meet body weight restrictions of 265 pounds. A medical practitioner will assess successful candidates to ensure they meet these requirements at all times during their employment.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Relocation may be offered for this role should it be necessary\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Accountable for site management of both domestic and foreign construction sites. Coordinates and guides several parties involved.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Ensures adherence to defined guidelines, processes, and procedures, for all site operations assigned.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Oversees completion of site administration according to performance standards agreed (on schedule, at requisite quality level, on-budget).\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Assumes economic responsibility, e.g., calculates material, personnel, and running contract costs for suppliers.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Represents the site in all decision-making committees of the project (towards own management, customer, and team).\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Coordinates contractors before and during execution of work.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Establishes efficient methods\u002Fprocesses for site controlling and reporting.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Assesses risks\u002Fopportunities at the construction site (e.g., economic, organizational or contractual risks, acceptance criteria, change request procedures).\n
