It will be tasked to drive a consistent tooling strategy, help focus our efforts to reduce NCs related to tools, lower costs through more robust tooling maintenance and inventorying processes\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Relocation will not be offered for this role.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     To support all Major Project department in the areas of :\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Managing the MP CAPEX Forecast and CAPEX tool purchases\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Be targeted to drive Tooling NC reduction, and find productivity improvement initiative in our tooling process as well as the type of tooling we use, how they are being deployed in the field etc\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Establish and manage Inventory\u002Fmaintenance process (in field, in warehouse), tracking, calibration etc.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Take the lead on any tooling management system changes\u002Fnew implementations\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Will build and maintain our tooling strategy to 2-3 year outlook - New Fleet readiness\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Leads tooling strategy discussions Storage location, quantities, kit configuration\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Set expectations for warehouses  monitors and reports on KPIs\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Required Knowledge, Education, Experience and Skills\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     A technical degree\u002Fdiploma in an engineering related field, or equivalent combination of education and experience.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     3-5 years experience in Tooling management\u002Fplanning using standardized tools preferably in the wind industry\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Highly competent in the Microsoft office suite, SAP\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Comfortable generating reports and Presentations to status progress to Senior Management within SGRE.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Field engineering background, experience in wind turbine industry is preferred.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Be able to travel international as required.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   #Mid-Senior\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   To learn more about Siemens Gamesa, check out these videos:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How do you imagine the future?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   SGRE is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. The position is primary office based and expected meeting activity.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Travel activity are expected 30-50 days on an annual base.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Relocation may be offered for this role should it be necessary.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As Marine Operations Manager you will manage the scope of Marine Operations Management for the US offshore wind projects according to defined project management policies, guidelines, programs and standards.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We are looking for experience in marine operations such as project specific marine spread, contractual and vessel charter party understanding, negotiations, skill development conflict management, scheduling budget, planning and managing the time scales for this role.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Experience of working in high complexity, high stress operational projects with people management in offshore operations - wind or oil &amp; gas industry will best fit for this role. the project\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Plan, source, prepare and mobilize the Installation Vessel\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Plan, source, prepare and Commercial and claim management of assets and suppliers.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Understand and support a strong culture of safety within the marine operations management, ensuring that the influences to safe project execution are initiated in the earliest planning phase and continue thru all aspects of work.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Understand the organization as primary internal support and strive for supporting the project organization in all aspects of maritime management.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Ensure a close <div>\n     It is key that you have a profound cross-functional understanding of business process description on a global scale. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Summary:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We are looking for highly motivated Sales professionals to internally lead commercial and technical activities related to the sale of renewable energy products (wind turbines, service, etc.) within the Americas region. Successful candidates have the ability to execute the complete sales process including the management of proposal generation and contract negotiation. This individual will be the primary liaison between Siemens Gamesa account Manager \u002F customer and all other internal Siemens Gamesa support functions that support of acquisition of new turbine sale. Positive, persistent, self-motivated and action oriented candidates with demonstrated transaction experience are required. Ability to lead and manage multiple priorities at same time is desired. External customer and Internal organizational negotiation experience desired.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Relocation may be offered for this role should it be necessary.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Primary lead on all account activities, serving as the internal voice of customer, directly supporting the Account Sales team.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Leads and facilitates all Request For Proposal (RFP) activity and deliverables to achieve on-time response and fulfillment of customer requests, this includes pricing, schedules, and technical documentation as defined by RFP.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Leads and facilitates contracting process; acting as primary liaison between legal, account manager, and customer. Includes support and creation of contract exhibits, schedules, and other project-specific documents.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Active participant in all contract negotiations for both the purchase of equipment and service. Must have the ability to negotiate and facilitate successful outcomes between Siemens Gamesa stakeholders and customers.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Responsible for the internal handover of signed projects to Project Management organization after execution of customer agreements.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support Marketing and Account team with compilations of competitive intelligence and market-related studies for assigned accounts.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Expected travel of 15 % domestically within US &amp; Canada. (Customer interactions, contracting, RFPs, as directed by the Account Manager or Sales Director.)<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Required Knowledge, Education, Experience, and Skills\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> B.S. in Engineering or Business field<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to manage multiple projects, prioritize, and meet deadlines<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong written and verbal communication skills as well as presentation skills; able to present information through the spoken &amp; written word; influence or persuade others in positive or negative circumstances<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Able to work in a high volume fast pace environment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to work cooperatively and collaboratively with all levels of employees, management, and external agencies to maximize performance, creativity, problem-solving, and results<\u002Fli>\n  <li> MS Word\u002FPowerPoint\u002FExcel and CRM tools<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong organizational skills; ability to organize and follow through with projects; an eye for detail and accuracy<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Qualified applicants may be allowed remote working opportunities, based on business needs<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Qualified applicants must be legally authorized for employment in the United States. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Overview:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The Wind Service Technician performs planned and unplanned maintenance including troubleshooting and replacement of parts if necessary, in a safe and professional manner on Wind Turbines. Detailed records and parts used must be completed for all work performed. Technicians report to site management and communicate needs and or safety issues that arise. Perform first class work on preventive maintenance to be completed on time and right the first time.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Duties and Responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Performs mainly pre-defined, technical tasks (for example, basic commissioning of products and systems, integration of components to a system, basic engineering, maintenance jobs) and work packages on-site and remotely.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Coordinates and accomplishes defined service operations and\u002For resolves product issues for customers equipment.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Adheres to defined processes and applicable regulations.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to analyze and resolve problems independently and efficiently.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide excellent service to our customers. Work in stressful, dangerous situations, and participate in the development of new field procedures and best practices<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Actively work on wind power projects.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Service and maintenance wind turbines<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Troubleshoot errors on wind turbine<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Be self-motivated, able to think quickly and address issues as they arise<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Flexible travel schedules up to 10-25% travel.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Complete and maintain required and accurate documentation and records.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Flexibility to work outside planned hours, including nights and weekends as needed and on-call.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Work in varying temperature conditions, and adverse weather conditions.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Requirements:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Must have verifiable hands on experience in Mechanical processes, Plant Maintenance, Mill Work, Field Services, etc .<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Physically and mentally able to work suspended from heights and in confined spaces<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Climb Wind towers (up to 300 feet) multiple times and at times without climbing aids or lifts.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> High school diploma or equivalent.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must meet body weight restrictions of 265 lbs. or less as required by the equipment safety regulations.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must pass a physical administered by a medical examiner to ensure ability to safely perform the job functions and meet the physical demands of the position.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must pass pre-hire drug screening.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Driving is an essential function of the job and applicants must have a valid drivers license at the time of application with an acceptable driving record. Employees must maintain a valid license and acceptable driving record and may be subject to periodic DMV checks of their license.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Qualified applicants must be legally authorized for employment in the United States. Qualified applicants will not require employer sponsored work authorization now or in the future for employment in the United States.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Relocation may be offered for this role should it be necessary<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   #Entry\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   To learn more about Siemens Gamesa, check out these videos:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How do you imagine the future?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Equal Employment Opportunity Statement\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Overview\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Join one of the worlds leading suppliers of wind power solutions as a Wind Technician for Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy! Demand for electricity generated from renewable sources is growing fast, and Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy has the answers. As one of the market leaders, we combine technological innovations, experience, and expertise to deliver readily available, one-stop solutions and have a proven track record of successfully delivering wind power projects on all continents. SGRE is currently seeking highly talented and motivated candidates for a Wind Technician position. The candidate will work together with a multi-disciplinary group to ensure top performance on our wind farms. The ideal candidate has the ability to work a flexible schedule, along with the ability to analyze and resolve problems independently and efficiently. S\u002Fhe will provide excellent service to our customers, have the ability to work on complex systems in challenging environments, and participate in the development of new field procedures and best practices.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <ul>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n      The Wind Service Technician position is located in Primary Location of the position is at the Kawailoa Wind Farm in Haleiwa, HI\n It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology.<\u002Fi>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. You will contribute to strong competitive solutions to make the difference for our customers and their business cases.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Relocation may be offered for this role should it be necessary.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Working closely with our customers from first customer interaction until contract signature and hand over to our project execution team; Lead the commercial and legal negotiations and all business case related items.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Putting together compelling offers.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Working with the Sales Director and Sales Project Manager to develop and drive the sales \u002Fnegotiation strategies.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Clarification, annotation, mark-up and negotiation of commercial and financial terms and conditions.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Elaboration of commercial and financial documents for the sales and bidding process.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Managing the internal sales process by preparing approval documentation and ensuring sufficient mandate on legal, commercial and financial risks. Represent your project within approval meetings towards Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy senior management.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Leading commercial evaluation of risks and opportunities facing your projects in alignment with experts and stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Managing the project cost calculation in alignment with the Cost Manager and Commercial Project Manager until signed at order entry level.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Preparation of project specific sales forecasts and budgets.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Participating in knowledge sharing on an ongoing basis by implementation, identification and registration of lessons learned.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Required Knowledge\u002FSkills, Education, and Experience\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. We are also looking for\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Academic background in Business Administration, Finance, Legal or comparable education with professional experience.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> International project experience, preferably in the (wind) energy or construction industry.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Profound knowledge on calculation methods, finance models, project financing and strong awareness on commercial &amp; financial topics (bonds, escalation, currency, indemnities, liabilities, etc.).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Profound knowledge in legal aspects, contract management and contract negotiation.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Excellent communication and negotiation skills.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to understand customer commercial requirements and bid evaluation methods.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> An enthusiastic individual with ability to work under tight deadlines and within a geographically diverse team.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> High degree of accountability and commitment.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Willingness to travel and work in a global environment.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Team player with customer focus, initiative and assertiveness.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Fluent (speaking, reading, writing) in English language.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Understanding and experience of working within a large, complex and ideally multi-national organization; will be preferable.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Qualified applicants may be allowed remote working opportunities, based on business needs.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Qualified applicants must be legally authorized for employment in the United States. Demand for electricity generated from renewable sources is growing fast, and Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy has the answers. As one of the market leaders, we combine technological innovations, experience, and expertise to deliver readily available, one-stop solutions and have a proven track record of successfully delivering wind power projects on all continents. SGRE is currently seeking highly talented and motivated candidates for a Wind Technician position. The candidate will work together with a multi-disciplinary group to ensure top performance on our wind farms. The ideal candidate has the ability to work a flexible schedule, along with the ability to analyze and resolve problems independently and efficiently. S\u002Fhe will provide excellent service to our customers, have the ability to work on complex systems in challenging environments, and participate in the development of new field procedures and best <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Wind Technician- Service Technician\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Overview\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Join one of the worlds leading suppliers of wind power solutions as a Wind Technician for Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy! Demand for electricity generated from renewable sources is growing fast, and Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy has the answers. As one of the market leaders, we combine technological innovations, experience, and expertise to deliver readily available, one-stop solutions and have a proven track record of successfully delivering wind power projects on all continents. SGRE is currently seeking highly talented and motivated candidates for a Wind Technician position. The candidate will work together with a multi-disciplinary group to ensure top performance on our wind farms. The ideal candidate has the ability to work a flexible schedule, along with the ability to analyze and resolve problems independently and efficiently. S\u002Fhe will provide excellent service to our customers, have the ability to work on complex systems in challenging environments, and participate in the development of new field procedures and best practices.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Travel up to 50% in the first year of employment, followed by up to 20% in the following years<\u002Fli>\n  <li> The Wind Service Technician position is Located at the US - Colby, KS<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Service and maintenance wind turbines<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Troubleshoot errors on wind turbine<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Escalate technical issues to supporting engineering functions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Perform mainly pre-defined, technical tasks (for example, basic commissioning of products and systems, integration of components to a system, basic engineering, maintenance jobs) and work packages on-site and remotely.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support customer remotely and onsite and provides 2nd and 3rd level user support in case of arising issues.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Coordinates and accomplishes defined service operations and\u002For resolves product issues for customers equipment.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Supports in generating sales leads for pre-defined service offers and contributes to planning activities.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Adheres to defined processes and applicable regulations.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Be self-motivated, able to think quickly and address issues as they arise<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to work a flexible work schedule is required, along with the ability to analyze and resolve issues independently and efficiently<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Required Knowledge\u002F Skills, Education, and Experience\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Driving is an essential function of the job and applicants must have a valid drivers license at the time of application with an acceptable driving record. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Overview\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Join one of the worlds leading suppliers of wind power solutions as a Wind Technician for Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy! Demand for electricity generated from renewable sources is growing fast, and Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy has the answers. As one of the market leaders, we combine technological innovations, experience, and expertise to deliver readily available, one-stop solutions and have a proven track record of successfully delivering wind power projects on all continents. SGRE is currently seeking highly talented and motivated candidates for a Wind Technician position. The candidate will work together with a multi-disciplinary group to ensure top performance on our wind farms. The ideal candidate has the ability to work a flexible schedule, along with the ability to analyze and resolve problems independently and efficiently. S\u002Fhe will provide excellent service to our customers, have the ability to work on complex systems in challenging environments, and participate in the development of new field procedures and best practices.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Relocation may be offered for this role should it be necessary.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Essential Duties &amp; tasks (for example, basic commissioning of products and systems, integration of components to a system, basic engineering, maintenance jobs) and work packages on-site and remotely.\n <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Summary:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The Wind Service Technician performs planned and unplanned maintenance including troubleshooting and replacement of parts if necessary, in a safe and professional manner on Wind Turbines. Detailed records and parts used must be completed for all work performed. Technicians report to site management and communicate needs and or safety issues that arise. Perform first class work on preventive maintenance to be completed on time and right the first time\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Relocation may be offered for this role should it be necessary.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Essential Duties &amp; Responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Performs mainly pre-defined, technical tasks (for example, basic commissioning of products and systems, integration of components to a system, basic engineering, maintenance jobs) and work packages on-site and remotely.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Supports customer remotely and onsite.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Coordinates and accomplishes defined service operations and\u002For resolves product issues for customers equipment.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Adheres to defined processes and applicable regulations.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Ability to analyze and resolve problems independently and efficiently.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Provide excellent service to our customers.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Work in stressful, dangerous situations, and participate in the development of new field procedures and best practices Actively work on wind power projects.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Flexible travel schedule up to 10-25% travel. Complete and maintain required and accurate documentation and records.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Flexibility to work outside planned hours, including nights and weekends as needed and on-call\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Work in varying temperature conditions, and adverse weather conditions.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Requirements:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Must have minimum of 6 months verifiable hands on experience in Tower construction, Plant Maintenance, Mill Work etc .\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Physically and mentally able to work suspended from heights and in confined spaces\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Climb Wind towers (up to 300 feet) multiple times and at times without climbing aids or lifts. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Overview:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     The Wind Service Technician performs planned and unplanned maintenance including troubleshooting and replacement of parts if necessary, in a safe and professional manner on Wind Turbines. Detailed records and parts used must be completed for all work performed. Technicians report to site management and communicate needs and or safety issues that arise. Perform first class work on preventive maintenance to be completed on time and right the first time.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Relocation may be offered for this role should it be necessary.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Performs mainly pre-defined, technical tasks (for example, basic commissioning of products and systems, integration of components to a system, basic engineering, maintenance jobs) and work packages on-site and remotely.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Supports customer remotely and onsite, and provides 2nd and 3rd level user support in case of arising issues.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Coordinates and accomplishes defined service operations and\u002For resolves product issues for customers equipment.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Supports in generating sales leads for pre-defined service offers and contributes to planning activities.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Adheres to defined processes and applicable regulations.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Ability to analyze and resolve problems independently and efficiently.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Provide excellent service to our customers.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Work in stressful, dangerous situations, and participate in the development of new field procedures and best practices Actively work on wind power projects.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Flexible travel schedule up to 10% travel. Complete and maintain required and accurate documentation and records.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Flexibility to work outside planned hours, including nights and weekends as needed and on-call\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Work in varying temperature conditions, and adverse weather conditions.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Required Knowledge, Skills, Education, and Experience:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Must have minimum of 6 months verifiable hands on experience in Tower construction, Plant Maintenance, A&amp;P license, Mill Work etc .\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Physically and mentally able to work suspended from heights and in confined spaces\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Climb Wind towers (up to 300 feet) multiple times and at times without climbing aids or lifts. Willing to travel up to 100%\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     High school diploma or equivalent.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Must meet body weight restrictions of 265 lbs. or less as required by the equipment safety regulations.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Must pass a physical administered by a medical examiner to ensure ability to safely perform the job functions and meet the physical demands of the position.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Must pass pre-hire drug screening.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Driving is an essential function of the job and applicants must have a valid drivers license at the time of application with an acceptable driving record. Demand for electricity generated from renewable sources is growing fast, and Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy has the answers. As one of the market leaders, we combine technological innovations, experience, and expertise to deliver readily available, one-stop solutions and have a proven track record of successfully delivering wind power projects on all continents. SGRE is currently seeking highly talented and motivated candidates for a Wind Technician position. The candidate will work together with a multi-disciplinary group to ensure top performance on our wind farms. The ideal candidate has the ability to work a flexible schedule, along with the ability to analyze and resolve problems independently and efficiently. S\u002Fhe will provide excellent service to our customers, have the ability to work on complex systems in challenging environments, and participate in the development of new field procedures and best <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Overview\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We are now recruiting for offshore High Voltage Commissioning Manager to join our team. As an offshore High Voltage Commissioning Manager , you will be part of a permanently employed team who are dedicated and responsible for the Offshore wind farm construction at Siemens Gamesa, as a High voltage Commissioning manager, you will undertake operational, technical and safety from the system duties on high voltage systems on 36kV  145kV networks associated with the construction, maintenance and commissioning of Offshore windfarms. You will play a key role in ensuring the teams are set to work safely and to ensure the High Voltage equipment is fit for purpose as it is energized or re-energized.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Based in Orlando, FL, you will work in an international team of offshore construction operations. Our Offshore High Voltage Commissioning manager will need to be flexible to travel and working away from home Domestic and Internationally as needed. The role will provide you with lots of variety, learning and development opportunities along with an exceptional team culture. We offer a competitive basic salary, generous holiday allowance, bonus scheme, and contributory pension.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In the role of Offshore High Voltage Commissioning Manager at Siemens Gamesa, you will be responsible for.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Lead and manage staff:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Act as a model for the safety culture, ensuring: The safety of our workforce is the highest priority, No intentional or unintentional pressure is applied to bypass or minimize safety related activities, Safety equipment is always available, or work is stopped, All components of the safety programs are supported (e.g., observations, risk assessments, etc.)\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Prepare or review switching schedules for maintenance tasks, installation work, fault location and repair on high voltage networks where required.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Maintain own competence in accordance with legislative changes and customer requirements and the capability to obtain (System Control Engineer 400KV) status within a year after employment\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Support the management of Offshore Construction in providing the electrical expertise necessary to facilitate projects and co-ordinate safe and effective programmes including but not limited to: work instructions. Test specifications. Checklists and switching schedules\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Plan outages and produce switching programmes and liaise with System Control\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Facilitate a safe working environment during high voltage working\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Identify and release apparatus to be worked on by issue of Safety Documents and Permits to Work\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Organise and execute HV switching, isolation, earthing, identification of the point of work and issue of safety documentation duties on HV networks up to 145kV and\u002For in accordance with Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy operational Safety Rules.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Develop training programs and train SGRE and sub-contractor staff in specific HV systems.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Engender a positive working culture within the team, covering health and safety, workmanship quality, attention to detail and development of the business's team ethic.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Assist in the planning and logistical support aspects of all projects and works.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Relocation will be offered for this role if necessary\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div>\n   You will also:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Supervise\u002Fperform the following activities (at worldwide offshore locations) on switchgear, transformer, and related equipment.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> Installation and commissioning<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Maintenance<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Systems testing and fault diagnosis<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Document test results and produce site work reports.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Contribute to the formulation of offers for site activities.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Participate in necessary schemes to provide 24\u002F7 cover.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Support the Global Head of hazardous energies in the design review of HV systems and infrastructures for future turbine types and prototypes.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Offer on-site support on request from Offshore construction sites during installation and commissioning\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   This role is strongly focused on leadership. The individual must be capable of inspiring performance of employees (within and without his\u002Fher organization) through both formal and informal means. District managers must navigate through ambiguous situations that lack precedent and deliver outcomes that are favorable for both customers and Siemens, with minimal supervisory input. District managers must be effective communicators, able to create compelling written documents and make convincing presentations, to staff members, peers, and executives, as well as customers.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   This also includes ensuring that the manager is kept informed of all necessary matters.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Required Knowledge, Skills, Education, Experience and Abilities\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     In High Voltage Engineering or other relevant degree in Electrical Engineering\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Several years of operation and commissioning experience within the field of high voltage electricity, offshore experience preferable\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Appropriate electrical qualification and background related to the authorization scope.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Minimum 3 year of working experience within onshore substations systems\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Readiness for international cooperation and ideally already first experiences in international companies\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Qualified applicants must expect 30  40 days of traveling domestic and international a year\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     As a person you are self-determined and persistent, but at the same time open and communicative\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Knowledge in handling Microsoft Office\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Team player\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     30 to 40 days of travelling required with this position\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Qualified applicants must be legally authorized for employment in the United States. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv> This is a Finance\u002FAccounting internship position for the Summer of 2023. The internship is in SGREs Spare Parts &amp; Supplies (SPS) Americas Finance Team within the Service business unit.\n <br> \n <br> The SGRE Summer Intern Program runs from May 15  August 11, 2023.\n <div>\n   The intern will be responsible for a 3-month long project to analyze current material cost fluctuations for fiscal year 2023. With this analysis, as well as reviewing input and data from Procurement, the intern will calculate and propose the fixed pricing structure for all materials in fiscal year 2024. This new fixed pricing schedule will be implemented and made effective in our new fiscal year. The following\n  <br> are detailed tasks that the intern will perform:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <ul>\n   <li><br> Collaborating with SPS Americas Finance team members to understand current<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> material cost and price fluctuations.\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Using SAP to extract material cost and price reports.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Consolidating and analyzing numerous sets of data to determine cost fluctuations during current fiscal year.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Business partnering with Strategic Procurement to gather and review upcoming<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> purchase information records for materials.\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Using SAP to conduct root-cause analyses of cost and pricing fluctuations<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Troubleshooting cost discrepancies related to material unit of measure issues,<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> goods receipt errors, etc.\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Calculating fixed prices for all materials to ensure appropriate sales margin.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Presenting fixed price schedule of materials for upcoming fiscal year to<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> Management.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Required Knowledge, Skills, Education, Experience and Abilities\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li><br> Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Finance, Accounting, Business, or other<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> relevant field\n <br> \n <ul>\n  <li>Demonstrated ability to influence behavior and outcomes in a matrix organization where decision-making is not always clear<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Understanding of how business choices can impact financial statements (e.g., the interplay between inventory and COS)<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Strong quantitative and analytical skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Strong proficiency with Excel and PowerPoint<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Qualified applicants must be legally authorized for employment in the United<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> States. Qualified applicants will not require employer sponsored work\n <br> authorization now or in the future for employment in the United States.\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Preferred Knowledge\u002FSkills, Education, and Experience\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>Past work experience in Supply Chain or a Supply Chain Finance organization is a plus<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Working knowledge of Power BI, Alteryx or RPA is a plus<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   To learn more about Siemens Gamesa, check out these videos:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How do you imagine the future?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Equal Employment Opportunity Statement\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Overview\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Siemens Gamesa is looking for Real estate senior construction project manager in the RE Building Solutions and Standard department.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     This position is responsible for several major design and construction projects by providing your project expertise\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     You will establish and manage interfaces with cross-functional and international teams within Siemens Gamesa, e.g.: Operations (industrial) teams, HSE, IT, Security, Legal, Procurement.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     You will contribute to grow the technical knowledge of the team you belong to, by owning several expertise topics. project managers\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     You will proactively manage and be accountable for the project execution in accordance with timeline, costs, risks, safety and quality.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     You will support the pre-construction activities of the project: scope definition, project setup and strategy, design, permitting, tendering and construction start.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     You will manage the construction activities of the project: General Contractor contract and claim management, HSE, handover to operations.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     You will hire and manage the activities of several subcontractors: designer, project management company, general contractor or built-to-suit developer.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     You will lead the interface towards the land owner or lessor, and local authorities for all permitting and construction At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Overview\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Join one of the worlds leading suppliers of wind power solutions as a Wind Technician for Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy! Demand for electricity generated from renewable sources is growing fast, and Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy has the answers. As one of the market leaders, we combine technological innovations, experience, and expertise to deliver readily available, one-stop solutions and have a proven track record of successfully delivering wind power projects on all continents. SGRE is currently seeking highly talented and motivated candidates for a Wind Technician position. The candidate will work together with a multi-disciplinary group to ensure top performance on our wind farms. The ideal candidate has the ability to work a flexible schedule, along with the ability to analyze and resolve problems independently and efficiently. S\u002Fhe will provide excellent service to our customers, have the ability to work on complex systems in challenging environments, and participate in the development of new field procedures and best practices. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Overview:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Leading the way forward in the renewable energy sector, Siemens Gamesa provides cleaner, more reliable and more affordable wind power. Our scale, global reach and proven track record ensure that we will play a central role in shaping the energy landscape of the future. Our Onshore North America Technical Office, under the New Units Projects organization, is looking for a talented individual with a Technical and attention to detail background to join our team who will be responsible for Final Documentation Specialist for all platforms in Projects.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Supports ramp-up and serial production by appropriate quality assurance measures for materials, products and services.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Relocation will not be offered for this role.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     The Final Documentation Specialist is responsible for the successful collection, organization and review of all the assembly documentation final documentation of SGRE turbines, both new and existing models, for ON North America Projects. Role involves close collaboration and coordination with Corporate Technical Office, Manufacturing, Construction, Procurement, Sales, Quality and Service organizations.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Create Wind Farm Functional Location structures in SAP systems, based on electrical diagrams and other Wind Farm structural documents provided by the PM and SCADA Manager.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Place requests to receive all main traceable components manufactory certificates, from plants and vendors. Review these for accuracy and classify them into the Final Documentation package, ordered by turbine.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Verify production SAP BoM records for all traceable components in SAP system are accurate. Request from the plant any changes be made when discrepancies are found, as sometimes traceable components may be missing in SAP, or the S\u002FN may be inaccurate.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Assist the PE in putting together the construction and commissioning checklists on the Index of Quality Assurance Documentation form INS1879 for our customer, prior to the delivery of the main components to the project site.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Advise the site QA of the required checklists to be executed based on the agreed Index. And setup the turbine SharePoint folders were these files need to be uploaded for review.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     During the construction phase, perform checklist reviews and classification from on all uploaded documents by the QA in SharePoint. Request the fixing of any checklists found with errors as needed.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Verify the Final Documentation package has all required Certificates and Checklists free of any errors. Arranged these in order by turbine ID.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Upload the Final Documentation package in SharePoint As Built Documentation folder and have the PM and PE review it before sharing this with our Customer.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Classify and mount all traceable components on their turbines in SAP systems, 30 days after the farm has been fully commissioned\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Required Knowledge, Skills, Education, and Experience\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Assist the PE in putting together the construction and commissioning checklists on the Index of Quality Assurance Documentation form INS1879 for our customer, prior to the delivery of the main components to the project site.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Advise the site QA of the required checklists to be executed based on the agreed Index. financial activities for projects in execution that you are assigned to.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy Limited has a flexible work arrangement policy.\n targets, with due professional care, optimizing the project gross profit, cash flow and assets and financing instruments.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Supports the Project Manager in identifying, evaluating and assessing project risks and opportunities and developing claim strategies.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensures contractual commercial obligations are clearly identified and delivered in a timely manner.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Responsible for cost accounting and controlling as well as planning, forecasting, and reporting of financial results and variances for the projects on a monthly basis to senior management.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> SAP updates including cost plan changes, contractual milestone billings, analysis of actual results, and other assigned SAP tasks as requested<\u002Fli>\n  <li> <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Summary:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The Wind Service Technician performs planned and unplanned maintenance including troubleshooting and replacement of parts if necessary, in a safe and professional manner on Wind Turbines. Detailed records and parts used must be completed for all work performed. Technicians report to site management and communicate needs and or safety issues that arise. Perform first class work on preventive maintenance to be completed on time and right the first time\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Essential Duties &amp; Responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Performs mainly pre-defined, technical tasks (for example, basic commissioning of products and systems, integration of components to a system, basic engineering, maintenance jobs) and work packages on-site and remotely.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Supports customer remotely and onsite, and provides 2nd and 3rd level user support in case of arising issues.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Coordinates and accomplishes defined service operations and\u002For resolves product issues for customers equipment.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Supports in generating sales leads for pre-defined service offers and contributes to planning activities.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Adheres to defined processes and applicable regulations.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to analyze and resolve problems independently and efficiently.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide excellent service to our customers.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Work in stressful, dangerous situations, and participate in the development of new field procedures and best practices Actively work on wind power projects.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Flexible travel schedule up to 10-25% travel. Complete and maintain required and accurate documentation and records.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Flexibility to work outside planned hours, including nights and weekends as needed and on-call<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Work in varying temperature conditions, and adverse weather conditions.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Requirements:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Must have minimum of 6 months verifiable hands on experience in Tower construction, Plant Maintenance, A&amp;P license, Mill Work etc .<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Physically and mentally able to work suspended from heights and in confined spaces<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Climb Wind towers (up to 300 feet) multiple times and at times without climbing aids or lifts. Willing to travel up to 100%<\u002Fli>\n  <li> High school diploma or equivalent.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must meet body weight restrictions of 265 lbs. or less as required by the equipment safety regulations.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must pass a physical administered by a medical examiner to ensure ability to safely perform the job functions and meet the physical demands of the position.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must pass pre-hire drug screening.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Driving is an essential function of the job and applicants must have a valid drivers license at the time of application with an acceptable driving record. Employees must maintain a valid license and acceptable driving record and may be subject to periodic DMV checks of their license.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Qualified applicants must be legally authorized for employment in the United States. Qualified applicants will not require employer sponsored work authorization now or in the future for employment in the United States.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Relocation will not be offered for this role.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Sponsoring a visa is not approved for this role.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   # Entry Level\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   To learn more about Siemens Gamesa, check out these videos:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How do you imagine the future?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Equal Employment Opportunity Statement\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Overview\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     We are now recruiting for a Regional appointed Technical Lead to join our hazardous energies (CoHE) in the Offshore Construction team. You will be part of a permanently employed team who are dedicated and responsible for the Offshore wind farm construction at Siemens Gamesa, The Regional Appointed Technical Lead is an advancement of the Lead nominated person position and appointed by the National Offshore Managing Director or similar as well as The Global Head of Offshore Hazardous Energies.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     The technical and legal responsibility for Hazardous Energies is delegated for Offshore Construction in a specific country or region.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     You will hold responsibility for Control of Hazardous Energies in the offshore construction execution phase and, if agreed, the subsequently O&amp;M phase as well as act as National representative for Control of hazardous energies offshore.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     As a Regional appointed Technical Lead, you will undertake operational, technical, and legal responsibility for Hazardous Energies is delegated for Offshore Construction in a specific country or region. Networks associated with the construction, maintenance, and commissioning of Offshore windfarms. You will play a key role in ensuring the teams are set to work safely.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Based in Orlando, FL, you will work in an international team of offshore construction operations. Our Offshore High Voltage Commissioning manager will need to be flexible to travel and working away from home Domestic and Internationally as needed. The role will provide you with lots of variety, learning and development opportunities along with an exceptional team culture. We offer a competitive basic salary, generous holiday allowance, bonus scheme, and contributory pension.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In the role of Regional appointed Technical Lead at Siemens Gamesa, you will be responsible for:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Ensure that the SGRE Control of Hazardous Energies procedures are implemented and maintained on sites to the required standard and quality.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Ensuring priority is given to the safety of employees, customers and the public as defined by applicable company, country specific laws and regulations, including but not limited to electrical installations.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Representing SGRE as the CoHE specialist towards authorities in matters relating to Offshore construction and O&amp;M CoHE.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Support the management of Offshore Construction in providing the electrical expertise necessary to facilitate projects and co-ordinate safe and effective programmes\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Contribute to establish globalized working methods, techniques and ensure correct electrical competence level among personnel.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Ensure that the processes and the execution of work is complying with relevant legislation and SGRE internal regulations, and with an obligation to ensure global standardization to the highest possible extend\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Monitor the daily activity of Offshore CoHE and support the global organization toward effective and integrated COHE procedures. Support development, expert knowledge, and adherence to local regulations \u002F statutory requirements.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Implement, maintain, and communicate the site-specific electrical organization in adherence to the organisation's environmental, health and safety and security procedures.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Collate, <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv> Responsible for driving internal commercial Sales processes such as SBA, Contract Review and risk management\n <br> Lead negotiations of contractual terms and conditions.\n <br> Support in monthly forecast and annual budget process.\n <div>\n   Responsible\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Lead and facilitate the SBA process (forecasting, preparation, follow-up, commercial term review and approval requests) to ensure timely delivery of necessary input from support functions.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Confirm compliance with SBA mandates for signing contracts (Prices, Conditions, CPs)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> R&amp;O: Evaluate commercially risk and opportunity analysis with SBA (manage risk &amp; opportunity review workshops with all stakeholders and ensure transparency on commercial evaluation of identified risks\u002Fcontingencies and pportunities)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Organize risk workshops with all main stakeholders as part of the SBA preparation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide, evaluate and confirm compliance of costs and accruals<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure compliance with released guidance provided by all internal stakeholders (Memos, F-Price, Budgets, etc.)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Request and prepare the commercial documentation together with the Project Team for the internal approvals (SBA) for ON<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Lead negotiations of terms and conditions with the Support of the Account Manager in contract negotiations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Identify, manage, and mitigate contract risk , including commercial risks e.g. cash-flow, currency, hedging risks.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Secure financial instruments in terms of payment, insurances, export control, liability regime, etc.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Complete and timely execute all necessary financial\u002Fcommercial documents for the sales and bidding process<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Audit and process: Represent Sales in periodic internal and external process audits; maintains Sales procedures and compliance<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Continuous Improvement: Ensure collection of lessons learned and considering LCOE for our customers as critical driver.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Contract Review: Launch Independent Contract Review request once contract\u002Fagreement is ready for signature<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Project Handover: Complete and timely deliver all financial\u002Fcommercial relevant documents and inform the project execution<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Other: Support Regional Commercial Head (legal entity creation is the scope of the regional \u002F subregional Commercial Head) RPT process when required<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Coordinate activities with non-Sales functions such as: SFS, legal, taxes, insurance, ECC, Compliance, Treasury<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Follow up with Sales about the signature of contracts and contract activation providing evidence that all CPs have been fulfilled (to book project)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Train and support Salesforce users on processes and procedures<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support report creation and data utilization<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Perform periodic audits for data consistency, accuracy of CRM financial data for their projects<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   #Associte\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   To learn more about Siemens Gamesa, check out these videos:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How do you imagine the future?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Equal Employment Opportunity Statement\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Overview\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Perform installation, repairs, preventive maintenance, and alterations to complex machinery, machine tools, lifting equipment, and fixtures. Record all required data of repairs and installations. Interpret and implement corrective actions from prints, drawings, and verbal instructions. Recommend appropriate corrective action in accordance with referenced specifications, accepted industry and shop practices. Perform mechanical construction work as required.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Job Responsibilities\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The following are the major job duties but this job description does not preclude the performance of other duties by the incumbent.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Receive and perform work assignments, oral and\u002For written and follow work instructions.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Accurately report findings of inspections to operations, supervisor, etc.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Document, organize, and retain all findings of evaluations and inspections in a timely manner.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Interpret drawings, sketches, etc. to determine necessary tools and materials needed for assignments.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Perform preventive electrical maintenance and routine repairs on all equipment and operating systems within the facility, including electrical boxes, wires, switches, gearboxes, transmissions, hydraulic &amp; lubrication systems, injection, heating, and molding equipment.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Perform inspections on lifting equipment such as chains, cables, shackles, eyebolts, clamps, and lifting beams to determine the safe operating condition.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Maintain records as required. Fabricate, weld, and braze materials as needed.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Install piping and conduit as needed.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Enter and <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Overview:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint  join us in creating a better future for our planet. With a worldwide installed capacity of 75 GW, Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy has a presence in more than 90 countries and a team of 24,000 employees worldwide. Its end-to-end value chain presence encompasses onshore and offshore wind turbines design, manufacturing, installation as well as cutting-edge service solutions.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     The Wind Service Technician performs planned and unplanned maintenance including troubleshooting and replacement of parts if necessary, in a safe and professional manner on Wind Turbines. Detailed records and parts used must be completed for all work performed. Technicians report to site management and communicate needs and or safety issues that arise. Perform first class work on preventive maintenance to be completed on time and right the first time.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Relocation may be offered for this role should it be necessary\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div>\n   Essential Duties &amp; Responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Performs mainly pre-defined, technical tasks (for example, basic commissioning of products and systems, integration of components to a system, basic engineering, maintenance jobs) and work packages on-site and remotely.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Supports customer remotely and onsite, and provides 2nd and 3rd level user support in case of arising issues.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Coordinates and accomplishes defined service operations and\u002For resolves product issues for customers equipment.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Supports in generating sales leads for pre-defined service offers and contributes to planning activities.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Adheres to defined processes and applicable regulations.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Ability to analyze and resolve problems independently and efficiently.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Provide excellent service to our customers.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Work in stressful, dangerous situations, and participate in the development of new field procedures and best practices Actively work on wind power projects.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Flexible travel schedule up to 10-25% travel. Complete and maintain required and accurate documentation and records.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Flexibility to work outside planned hours, including nights and weekends as needed and on-call\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Work in varying temperature conditions, and adverse weather conditions.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Requirements:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Physically and mentally able to work suspended from heights and in confined spaces\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     0 - 6 months of experience into relative field\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Climb Wind towers (up to 300 feet) multiple times and at times without climbing aids or lifts.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Willing to travel up to 25%\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     High school diploma or equivalent.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Must meet body weight restrictions of 265 lbs. or less as required by the equipment safety regulations.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Must pass a physical administered by a medical examiner to ensure ability to safely perform the job functions and meet the physical demands of the position.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Must pass pre-hire drug screening.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Driving is an essential function of the job and applicants must have a valid drivers license at the time of application with an acceptable driving record. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Overview\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Join one of the worlds leading suppliers of wind power solutions as a Wind Site Manager for Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy! Demand for electricity generated from renewable sources is growing fast, and Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy has the answers. As one of the market leaders, we combine technological innovations, experience, and expertise to deliver readily available, one-stop solutions and have a proven track record of successfully delivering wind power projects on all continents. SGRE is currently seeking highly talented and motivated candidates for a Wind Site Manager position. The candidate will work together with a multi-disciplinary group to ensure top performance on our wind farms. The ideal candidate will have demonstrated results\u002Fexperience in the following areas: Employee Health &amp; Safety, Project Management, Performance Management, Staffing, Training assessments, Quality, Compliance, Financial Management, Customer Orientation, and Risk Management. This position will have commercial responsibility for successful on-site operations, drive continuous process improvements, and hold overall responsibility for site performance\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Additionally, the Site Manager position requires the candidate to be able to ascend to heights up to 250 feet or greater, work in confined spaces, discern colors and meet body weight restrictions of 265 pounds. A medical practitioner will assess successful candidates to ensure they meet these requirements at all times during their employment.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The Wind Site Manager position is located in ( Lincoln, IL)\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Ensures adherence to defined guidelines, processes, As one of the market leaders, we combine technological innovations, experience, and expertise to deliver readily available, one-stop solutions and have a proven track record of successfully delivering wind power projects on all continents. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Overview\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Join one of the worlds leading suppliers of wind power solutions as a Wind Site Manager for Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy! Demand for electricity generated from renewable sources is growing fast, and Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy has the answers. As one of the market leaders, we combine technological innovations, experience, and expertise to deliver readily available, one-stop solutions and have a proven track record of successfully delivering wind power projects on all continents. SGRE is currently seeking highly talented and motivated candidates for a Wind Site Manager position. The candidate will work together with a multi-disciplinary group to ensure top performance on our wind farms. The ideal candidate will have demonstrated results\u002Fexperience in the following areas: Employee Health &amp; Safety, Project Management, Performance Management, Staffing, Training assessments, Quality, Compliance, Financial Management, Customer Orientation, and Risk Management. This position will have commercial responsibility for successful on-site operations, drive continuous process improvements, and hold overall responsibility for site performance.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Additionally, the Site Manager position requires the candidate to be able to ascend to heights up to 250 feet or greater, work in confined spaces, discern colors and meet body weight restrictions of 265 pounds. A medical practitioner will assess successful candidates to ensure they always meet these requirements during their employment.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Relocation may be offered for this role should it be necessary.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     The Wind Site Manager position is based out of La Joya Windfarm (Encino, NM) - 25% travel required.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Ensures adherence to defined guidelines, processes, and procedures, for all site operations assigned.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Oversees completion of site administration according to performance standards agreed (on schedule, at requisite quality level, on-budget).\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Assumes economic responsibility, e.g., calculates material, personnel, and running contract costs for suppliers.\n <div>\n     Coordinates contractors before and during execution of work.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Establishes efficient methods\u002Fprocesses for site controlling and Perform mechanical construction work as required.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Job Responsibilities\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The following are the major job duties but this job description does not preclude the performance of other duties by the incumbent.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Receive and perform work assignments, oral and\u002For written and follow work instructions.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Accurately report findings of inspections to operations, supervisor, etc.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Document, organize, and retain all findings of evaluations and inspections in a timely manner.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Interpret drawings, sketches, etc. to determine necessary tools and materials needed for assignments.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Perform preventive electrical maintenance and routine repairs on all equipment and operating systems within the facility, including electrical boxes, wires, switches, gearboxes, transmissions, hydraulic &amp; lubrication systems, injection, heating, and molding equipment.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Perform inspections on lifting equipment such as chains, cables, shackles, eyebolts, clamps, and lifting beams to determine the safe operating condition.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Maintain records as required. Fabricate, weld, and braze materials as needed.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Install piping and conduit as needed.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Enter and
