It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Overview\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Join one of the worlds leading suppliers of wind power solutions as a Wind Site Manager for Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy! Demand for electricity generated from renewable sources is growing fast, and Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy has the answers. As one of the market leaders, we combine technological innovations, experience, and expertise to deliver readily available, one-stop solutions and have a proven track record of successfully delivering wind power projects on all continents. SGRE is currently seeking highly talented and motivated candidates for a Wind Site Manager position. The candidate will work together with a multi-disciplinary group to ensure top performance on our wind farms. The ideal candidate will have demonstrated results\u002Fexperience in the following areas: Employee Health &amp; Safety, Project Management, Performance Management, Staffing, Training assessments, Quality, Compliance, Financial Management, Customer Orientation, and Risk Management. This position will have commercial responsibility for successful on-site operations, drive continuous process improvements, and hold overall responsibility for site performance\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Additionally, the Site Manager position requires the candidate to be able to ascend to heights up to 250 feet or greater, work in confined spaces, discern colors and meet body weight restrictions of 265 pounds. A medical practitioner will assess successful candidates to ensure they meet these requirements at all times during their employment.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Relocation may be offered for this role should it be necessary.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Accountable for site management of both domestic and foreign construction sites. assigned.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Oversees completion of site administration according to performance standards agreed (on schedule, at requisite quality level, on-budget).\n <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Overview\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The senior tax accountant has a major role in the tax department. This person supports the Tax Manager. The Senior Tax Accountant will be responsible for all aspects of tax compliance for Federal, State and Local income taxes in the United States, Canada, and Puerto Rico, in addition to the monthly income tax provision for Canada or the US. You will also be the lead for Sales &amp; Use tax compliance for the US and Canada in addition to administering and managing all tax correspondence with tax agencies for business registration, business licenses and annual statement filings. The Senior Tax Accountant will report to the Tax Manager and will be the lead in the Tax Department. Also, this position will help the Junior Tax Accountant when needed. The majority of the time, this position will be able to work from home and will needed to come into the office as requested.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Relocation will not be offered for this role.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> Responsibilities\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Supervise\u002Fmanage all aspects of tax compliance for Federal, State and Local income taxes in the United States, Canada, and Puerto Rico.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Prepare monthly and year-end Canadian or US tax provision including true ups for provision to return.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Manage all aspects of sales and use tax compliance and become proficient with Vertex Software for Sales &amp; Use Tax.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Prepare commodity tax returns for the Canadian company.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Responsible for personal property and real estate tax payments, obtain inventory values for rendition reporting and monitor appraised values for accuracy\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Manage tax calendar to ensure timely filing of all tax returns and payments\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Administer and manage all tax correspondence with tax agencies including initial registration, follow-up inquiries, and general questionnaires, etc.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Prepare monthly Canadian Commodity tax filings.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     This position will be responsible for tracking intercompany transactions to assist in the preparation of the Transfer Pricing Study.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Required Knowledge, Skills, Education, and Experience\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     The candidate should have a bachelors degree in accounting. MS in Tax or a CPA is preferred not but required\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     The candidate should have 7-10 plus years of experience in tax\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Travel up to 10% will be required\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Working knowledge of the Tax provision, Federal and State Income taxes, Sales &amp; Use tax Compliance, ability to research tax issues. Vertex and SAP a plus. Proficient in Excel.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Ability to work independently with minimal supervision since we work from home 95% of the time.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Qualified applicants must be legally authorized for employment in the United States. Qualified applicants will not require employer sponsored work authorization now or in the future for employment in the United States\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Qualified applicants may be allowed remote working opportunities, based on business needs.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Preferred Knowledge, Skills, Education, and Experience\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Experience in Vertex Sales Tax software and OneSource products\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   #Mid-Senior\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   To learn more about Siemens Gamesa, check out these videos:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Empowering our people\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fwww.siemensgamesa.com\u002Fsustainability\u002Femployees\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   How do you imagine the future?\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n    https:\u002F\u002Fyoutu.be\u002F12Sm678tjuY\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Equal Employment Opportunity Statement\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Overview\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     The Wind Service Technician performs planned and unplanned maintenance including troubleshooting and replacement of parts if necessary, in a safe and professional manner on Wind Turbines. Detailed records and parts used must be completed for all work performed. Technicians report to site management and communicate needs and or safety issues that arise. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Overview:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Provides professional service and expertise in a broad, overarching and unspecified area of financial matters, which may include planning, analysis and reporting accountabilities for organizational unit(s) assigned. in a range of functional areas of all Siemens organization.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     This role will be responsible for inventory controlling, costing analysis and standard pricing, internal sales margin analysis, productivity measures, etc.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Relocation will not be offered for this role.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Completes financial planning and reporting activities for inventory.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Analyzes actual inventory results versus budgeted results; identifies variances &amp; investigates reasons for those variances.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Performs financial analysis regarding trends, financial structure, asset, cash and liabilities, etc. with a specific focus on inventory.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Creates monthly Balance Sheet account reconciliations for inventory accounts.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Conducts inventory research and performs system inventory tracking.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Develops annual costing structure for spare parts materials and monitors margin throughout the fiscal year.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Processes inventory cycle counts financially and approves material write-offs.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Analyses and monitors key performance indicators and business performance, and creates regular reports to management.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <ul>\n    <li>Partners with Supply Chain Management, Order Management and Warehouse Management to communicate inventory health and trends (e.g. material obsolescence, excess inventory, slow-moving inventory, etc.).<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     May perform and complete also projects re developing financial and controlling standards and guidelines.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Supports in risk management, treasury, M&amp;A or tax aspects in order to manage the financial resources best.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Carries out a range of operational tasks and project work in the area of expertise as assigned by superior.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Maintains working relations with external financial experts (e.g. banks, tax counselors, chartered accountants).\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     May also contribute to the (further) development of concepts and standards in the area of expertise based on operational experience.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     May include functional leadership.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Required Knowledge, Skills, Education, Experience and Abilities\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Finance, Accounting, Business, or other relevant field\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Demonstrated ability to influence behavior and outcomes in a matrix organization where decision-making is not always clear\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Understanding of how business choices can impact financial statements (e.g., the interplay between inventory and COS)\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     3+ years of SAP experience including knowledge of SAPs Material Management and Inventory Management (MM-IM) module\n <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv> Performs technical, mainly pre-defined tasks for accomplishing defined service delivery work for customer equipment.\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint  join us in creating a better future for our planet. With a worldwide installed capacity of 75 GW, Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy has a presence in more than 90 countries and a team of 24,000 employees worldwide. Its end-to-end value chain presence encompasses onshore and offshore wind turbines design, manufacturing, installation as well as cutting-edge service solutions.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Summary:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   The Wind Service Technician performs planned and unplanned maintenance including troubleshooting and replacement of parts if necessary in a safe and professional manner on Wind Turbines. Detailed records and parts used must be completed for all work performed. Technicians report to site management and communicate needs and or safety issues that arise. Perform first class work on preventive maintenance to be completed on time and right the first time.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> Essential Duties &amp; Responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Ability to analyze and resolve problems independently and efficiently.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide excellent service to our customers.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Work in stressful, dangerous situations, and participate in the development of new field procedures and best practices Actively work on wind power projects.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Flexibility to work outside planned hours, including nights and weekends as needed and on-call<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Work in varying temperature conditions, and adverse weather conditions.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> Requirements:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Must have 1 year of Wind Technician experience or 6 months in a related program paired with 6 months on a wind site.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must have minimum of 6 months training within the iron and metal industry or electrical field. Physically and mentally able to work suspended from heights and in confined spaces<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Climb Wind towers (up to 300 feet) multiple times and at times without climbing aids or lifts. Willing to travel up to 25%<\u002Fli>\n  <li> High school diploma or equivalent. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv> In this position you will be part of the Product Intetrity &amp; Technology (PI&amp;TE) family reporting directly to the head of the G2 Platform. The person in the Chief Mechanical Engineer position for the Service G2 Platform will ensure delivery of technical solutions while considering safety, time to resolution and cost.\n <div>\n   In the position as Chief Mechanical Engineer for the G2 platform you will be the primary contact person for mechanical issues affecting the G2 platform in Service. You will coordinate the different tasks within an assigned project team of mechanical engineers. Your goal will be to deliver technical solutions meeting the defined requirements based on technical norms and standards. Therefore, you will support the assigned mechanical engineers in their daily work.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In order to foster the customer relations, align priorities, apply the latest knowledge and to have influence on our business, you will establish, maintain and develop collaboration with many stakeholders within Service Technology, Service and Onshore Technology.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As the Chief Mechanical Engineer, you should have a passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead change. You will be responsible for review and approval of all mechanical changes impacting the G2 product under service design authority.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Tasks may include but are not limited to:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Ensuring the resolution of technical inquiries on a platform level regarding mechanical components and systems.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> Fully responsible for coordinating technical tasks inside the mechanical team assigned to the platform.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Responsible for ensuring the conformity of technical solutions with stakeholder requirements, technical codes and standards and technical design criteria defined by the mechanical unit.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Collaborate with the platform team and stakeholders to prioritize work and tasks<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Collaborate with team leads\u002Funit managers in order to apply latest knowledge.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Establish, develop, and maintain a technical and professional network to stay current on latest technologies, design practices, and industry standards.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Required Knowledge\u002FSkills, Education, and Experience\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Bachelors Degree in Mechanical Engineering<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> Minimum 5 years relevant work experience in field of Mechanical Engineering as it relates to wind turbines.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> Advanced degree may be substituted for experience, where applicable.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> Knowledge of how mechanical systems interaction with systems of other engineering disciplines to ensure all aspects are considered when defining design solutions.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> Broad knowledge in the field of mechanical engineering with an advanced understanding of wind turbine systems.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong skills in project management methods and tools is essential.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv> In this position you will be part of the Product Intetrity &amp; Technology (PI&amp;TE) family reporting directly to the head of the G2 Platform. The person in the Chief Mechanical Engineer position for the Service G2 Platform will ensure delivery of technical solutions while considering safety, time to resolution and cost.\n <div>\n   In the position as Chief Mechanical Engineer for the G2 platform you will be the primary contact person for mechanical issues affecting the G2 platform in Service. You will coordinate the different tasks within an assigned project team of mechanical engineers. Your goal will be to deliver technical solutions meeting the defined requirements based on technical norms and standards. Therefore, you will support the assigned mechanical engineers in their daily work.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   In order to foster the customer relations, align priorities, apply the latest knowledge and to have influence on our business, you will establish, maintain and develop collaboration with many stakeholders within Service Technology, Service and Onshore Technology.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   As the Chief Mechanical Engineer, you should have a passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead change. You will be responsible for review and approval of all mechanical changes impacting the G2 product under service design authority.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Tasks may include but are not limited to:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Ensuring the resolution of technical inquiries on a platform level regarding mechanical components and systems.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> Fully responsible for coordinating technical tasks inside the mechanical team assigned to the platform.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Responsible for ensuring the conformity of technical solutions with stakeholder requirements, technical codes and standards and technical design criteria defined by the mechanical unit.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Collaborate with the platform team and stakeholders to prioritize work and tasks<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Collaborate with team leads\u002Funit managers in order to apply latest knowledge.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Establish, develop, and maintain a technical and professional network to stay current on latest technologies, design practices, and industry standards.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Required Knowledge\u002FSkills, Education, mechanical systems interaction with systems of other engineering disciplines to ensure all aspects are considered when defining design solutions.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> Broad knowledge in the field of mechanical engineering with an advanced understanding of wind turbine systems.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong skills in project management methods and tools is essential.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv> Takes responsibility for the development, exploitation and maximization of the account penetration and profitable growth of assigned key customers for one or more organizational units in a country or region.\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <i> Sales Regional Account Manager<\u002Fi>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Overview\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   We are looking for a highly motivated and customer-focused Sales professional to lead commercial activities related to the sale of renewable energy products (wind turbines, service, etc.) within Texas &amp; Southwest region. Successful candidates will have the ability to execute the complete sales process including the management of proposal generation, strategy development, customer relationship management and contract negotiation. This is a client facing position wherein a candidate will represent Siemens Gamesa for all account \u002F commercial activities. Positive, persistent, self-motivated and action-oriented candidates with demonstrated transaction experience are required.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities\n <\u002Fdiv>\n process to gain influence on decision criteria\u002Ftenders and sustain frequent contact even in the absence of concrete new project opportunities<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develop strong, high performing relationships with existing customer base within the assigned region, while seeking to develop and grow new customers and associated relationships.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Support Customer with technical and commercial data on Siemens Gamesa offerings, including presentations, Indicative Offers and involvement from Technical Sales and Marketing, as needed.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Generate knowledge on the customer's specific strategy and its political and business environment.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Generate and evaluate of sales leads and business opportunities with assigned clients and\u002For region.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Develop negotiation strategy, management of value oriented offers and RFP responses, leading activities to successful conclusion.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Manage customer complaints as point of escalation, if necessary.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Coordinate customer actions with the Global Account Manager (where applicable)<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> Own the customer and sales opportunities throughout the Sales Process within Siemens Gamesa\n   <ul>\n    <li> direct and prioritize the activities of a multi-functional team within Siemens Gamesa<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Support development of winning strategy, scope definition and target price<\u002Fli>\n    <li> ensure uniform understanding of technical requirements, product selection, commercial strategy, cost \u002F price development needed for proposal generation.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Support and lead contract closure as appropriate.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Overview\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Join one of the worlds leading suppliers of wind power solutions as a Counsel - Commercial Law for Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy! Demand for electricity generated from renewable sources is growing fast, and Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy has the answers. As one of the market leaders, we combine technological innovations, experience, and expertise to deliver readily available, one-stop solutions and have a proven track record of successfully delivering wind power projects on all continents. SGRE is currently seeking highly talented and motivated candidates for a Lead Technician.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   A Lead Wind Turbine Technician will perform, and lead, both scheduled, and unscheduled, service and maintenance on Wind Turbines according to and in compliance with SGRE's HSE and Quality procedures and policies.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Relocation will not be offered for this role.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Adheres to SGRE's policies and procedures ensuring a safe, and profitable, with L1 and L2 Engineering teams, for technical support needs.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Support with the Technical Training, and development, of other technicians.\n <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Overview:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Siemens Wind Power and Gamesa have recently merged to create a leader in the renewable energy industry, to provide cleaner, more reliable and more affordable energy to society, and to create lasting value for all stakeholders. With a worldwide installed capacity of 75 GW, Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy has a presence in more than 90 countries and a team of 27,000 employees worldwide. Its end-to-end value chain presence encompasses onshore and offshores wind turbines design, manufacturing, installation as well as cutting-edge service solutions. The global headquarters and legal domicile of the company is located in Zamudio, Spain. The company is listed on the Spanish stock exchange.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     We are now recruiting for Installation and Commissioning Technicians, Technical Supervisors, and Technical Field Advisors to join our team.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     As an Offshore Construction Technician, you will be part of a permanently employed team who are dedicated and responsible for the installation and commissioning of wind turbine projects in line with safety guidelines, project requirements, corporate methods and industry legislative standards.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     SGRE is based in Orlando, USA, you can however be deployed to projects worldwide including (EU, and APAC). The role will provide you with lots of variety, learning and development opportunities along with an exceptional team culture. You will follow a shift pattern therefore a flexible approach to travel and working away from home on a continuing basis is essential. We offer a competitive basic salary, generous holiday allowance, bonus scheme, and contributory pension.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Relocation will not be offered for this role\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Perform, supervise, train and ensure safety during all phases of Wind Turbine Installation.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Prepare transition piece, tools, equipment and components during loadout and installation, as well as perform closure of punch lists during installation\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Keep and maintain accurate logbooks, documentation and reports as required by company policy\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Supervise and conduct the training of new colleagues \u002F 3rd party employees\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Ensure that work is conducted according to the defined workflow and work instructions\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Act as signaler in accordance with work instructions, checklists and lift plans\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Lead small teams\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Keep up to date with all required training as defined by your role profile.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Required Knowledge, Skills, Education, Experience and Abilities\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     The ideal candidate for this role will have hands on experience of all aspects of Wind Turbine Installation including Slinging, Signaling, Mechanical Completion, Retrofit &amp; Snagging works. In addition, knowledge of Low Voltage Electrical systems and isolation procedures, preferably in the form of a recognized qualification whilst not essential would be a distinct advantage.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     This role requires a high level of Health and Safety focus with experience of working with safe systems of work. You will demonstrate the ability to work as part of a team and\u002For on own initiative and have the ability and confidence to work at height. This includes appropriate physical fitness to climb and undertake some physical work. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Join one of the worlds leading suppliers of wind power solutions as a Wind Technician for Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy! Demand for electricity generated from renewable sources is growing fast, and Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy has the answers. As one of the market leaders, we combine technological innovations, experience, and expertise to deliver readily available, one-stop solutions and have a proven track record of successfully delivering wind power projects on all continents. SGRE is currently seeking highly talented and motivated candidates for a Wind Technician position. The candidate will work together with a multi-disciplinary group to ensure top performance on our wind farms. The ideal candidate has the ability to work a flexible schedule, along with the ability to analyze and resolve problems independently and efficiently. S\u002Fhe will provide excellent service to our customers, have the ability to work on complex systems in challenging environments, and participate in the development of new field procedures and best practices.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Travel up to 10% in the first year of employment.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Relocation may be offered for this role should it be necessary.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Essential Duties &amp; Projects Contracts values in range of $50M to $200M. They will provide excellent service to our customers, have the ability to work on complex systems in challenging environments, and participate in the development of new field procedures and best practices.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> The Wind Service Technician position is located in (Roscoe, TX)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Relocation may be offered for this role should it be necessary.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Service and maintenance wind turbines<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Troubleshoot errors on wind turbine<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Escalate technical issues to supporting engineering functions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Be self-motivated, able to think quickly and address issues as they arise<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to work a flexible work schedule is required, along with the ability to analyze and resolve issues independently and efficiently<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Required Knowledge\u002F Skills, Education, and Experience\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li> Driving is an essential function of the job and applicants must have a valid drivers license at the time of application with an acceptable driving record. <div>\n  It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Position Summary:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     The Wind Service Technician performs planned and unplanned maintenance including troubleshooting and replacement of parts if necessary, in a safe and professional manner on Wind Turbines. Detailed records and parts used must be completed for all work performed. Technicians report to site management and communicate needs and or safety issues that arise. Perform first class work on preventive maintenance to be completed on time and right the first time.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Relocation will not be offered for this role.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Essential Duties &amp; Responsibilities:\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Performs mainly pre-defined, technical tasks (for example, basic commissioning of products and systems, integration of components to a system, basic engineering, maintenance jobs) and work packages on-site and remotely.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Supports customer remotely and onsite, and provides 2nd and 3rd level user support in case of arising issues.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Coordinates and accomplishes defined service operations and\u002For resolves product issues for customers equipment.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Supports in generating sales leads for pre-defined service offers and contributes to planning activities.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Adheres to defined processes and applicable regulations.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Ability to analyze and resolve problems independently and efficiently.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Provide excellent service to our customers.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Work in stressful, dangerous situations, and participate in the development of new field procedures and best practices Actively work on wind power projects.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Flexible travel schedule up to 10-25% travel. Complete and maintain required and accurate documentation and records.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Flexibility to work outside planned hours, including nights and weekends as needed and on-call\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Work in varying temperature conditions, and adverse weather conditions.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n   Preferred knowledge , Education &amp; Skills :\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <ul>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Must have minimum of 6 months verifiable hands on experience in Tower construction, Plant Maintenance, A&amp;P license, Mill Work etc\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Physically and mentally able to work suspended from heights and in confined spaces\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Climb Wind towers (up to 300 feet) multiple times and at times without climbing aids or lifts. Willing to travel up to 100%\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     High school diploma or equivalent.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Must meet body weight restrictions of 265 lbs. or less as required by the equipment safety regulations.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Must pass a physical administered by a medical examiner to ensure ability to safely perform the job functions and meet the physical demands of the position.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Must pass pre-hire drug screening.\n   <\u002Fdiv><\u002Fli>\n  <li>\n   <div>\n     Driving is an essential function of the job and applicants must have a valid drivers license at the time of application with an acceptable driving record.
